commit_message:
libvirt: Always disconnect volumes after libvirtError exceptions

Building on Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760 we should always
attempt to disconnect volumes from the host when exceptions are thrown
while attempting to attach a volume to a domain. This was previously
done for generic exceptions but not for libvirtError exceptions.

Closes-Bug: #1826523
Change-Id: If21230869826c992e7d0398434b9a4b255940213
(cherry picked from commit 091a910576d9b580678f1881fffa425ab4632f48)
(cherry picked from commit 048d5b790f3da2756a0a1bf2bc015812cb24d53a)
(cherry picked from commit 786083c91fa69ba9ff90bafe80d3b83b9f9bbc69)

Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a attempted to introduce a

Unfortunately this change resulted in libvirtError exceptions that
didn't match the known issue being silently ignored.

commit_message:
libvirt: Stop ignoring unknown libvirtError exceptions during volume attach

Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a attempted to introduce a
simple breadcrumb in the logs to highlight a known Libvirt issue.
Unfortunately this change resulted in libvirtError exceptions that
didn't match the known issue being silently ignored.

This change corrects this by using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception
to ensure all libvirtError exceptions are logged and raised regardless
of being linked to the known issue.

Change-Id: Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760
Closes-Bug: #1825882
(cherry picked from commit bc57ae50734fa6a70115b6369e867079fb5eb4b8)
(cherry picked from commit b3dedefcc58a1fc76ba37f9f8bb1ef7d238aaceb)
(cherry picked from commit 34b4220448395f10eb2fd39d68b3f527339ab414)

commit_message:
Add recipe to create bash completions for OSC

The new recipe "completions" can be executed in order to create a file
with command completions for the "openstack" command in bash. We want
this to be dynamic because the set of available commands depends on the
set of python plugins installed on the host.

Change-Id: Ib6549c00596f6560dab74491309b6b580ae7b312

commit_message:
Drop admin endpoints

The admin endpoints offer no special functionality, users may talk to
the public endpoints instead. The only historic use case has been the
keystone v2 admin endpoint, but with keystone v3 API, even that is no
longer needed.

Also drop the attribute for setting an auth version, as keystone only
supports v3 now.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs/src/branch/master/specs/ocata/all/drop-admin-endpoints.rst

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/656289
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/656514
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/656518
Change-Id: Id8fa969af80bcb1cb6f3ce743b1861f26c36523f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-02 23:19:16.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo_rootwrap subprocess module in order to gain proper eventlet awareness

Via https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap/commit/31cfdbd4076bb6556cf9612171ba43fa44475d71
oslo.rootwrap gained support eventlet when using subprocess. By moving
to oslo_rootwrap.subprocess we make sure that with python3 the
subprocess calls use eventlet.green.subprocess if eventlet is used.
This worked on python2 because (from above commit):
"""
On Python 2, it "works" to use directly subprocess: subprocess.Popen
calls os.pipe() and os.fdopen(fd) which are both monkey-patched. On
Python 3, it doesn't work because subprocess uses os.pipe() and
io.open(fd), and the io module is *not* monkey-patched at all.
"""

By applying this change what happens is that the heartbeat thread is
able to be scheduled every 15seconds by default. Without this patch
what we have been observing with python3 is that while running ansible
mistral would constantly log error messages like the following:
2019-05-02 19:14:36.702 8 WARNING oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [-] Unexpected error during heartbeart thread processing, retrying...: amqp.exceptions.ConnectionForced: Too many heartbeats missed

With this change we could not reproduce this issue during a deployment
and no missed heartbeat messages were observed during the deploy.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1826281

Change-Id: Id22b1465d6d2424d90781983b970aba4545feb8a
'}, {'created': '2019-05-03 15:16:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo_rootwrap subprocess module in order to gain proper eventlet awareness

Via https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap/commit/31cfdbd4076bb6556cf9612171ba43fa44475d71
oslo.rootwrap gained support eventlet when using subprocess. By moving
to oslo_rootwrap.subprocess we make sure that with python3 the
subprocess calls use eventlet.green.subprocess if eventlet is used.
This worked on python2 because (from above commit):
"""
On Python 2, it "works" to use directly subprocess: subprocess.Popen
calls os.pipe() and os.fdopen(fd) which are both monkey-patched. On
Python 3, it doesn't work because subprocess uses os.pipe() and
io.open(fd), and the io module is *not* monkey-patched at all.
"""

By applying this change what happens is that the heartbeat thread is
able to be scheduled every 15seconds by default. Without this patch
what we have been observing with python3 is that while running ansible
mistral would constantly log error messages like the following:
2019-05-02 19:14:36.702 8 WARNING oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [-] Unexpected error during heartbeart thread processing, retrying...: amqp.exceptions.ConnectionForced: Too many heartbeats missed

With this change we could not reproduce this issue during a deployment
and no missed heartbeat messages were observed during the deploy.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1826281

Change-Id: Id22b1465d6d2424d90781983b970aba4545feb8a

commit_message:
Use oslo_rootwrap subprocess module in order to gain proper eventlet awareness

Via https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap/commit/31cfdbd4076bb6556cf9612171ba43fa44475d71
oslo.rootwrap gained support eventlet when using subprocess. By moving
to oslo_rootwrap.subprocess we make sure that with python3 the
subprocess calls use eventlet.green.subprocess if eventlet is used.
This worked on python2 because (from above commit):
"""
On Python 2, it "works" to use directly subprocess: subprocess.Popen
calls os.pipe() and os.fdopen(fd) which are both monkey-patched. On
Python 3, it doesn't work because subprocess uses os.pipe() and
io.open(fd), and the io module is *not* monkey-patched at all.
"""

By applying this change what happens is that the heartbeat thread is
able to be scheduled every 15seconds by default. Without this patch
what we have been observing with python3 is that while running ansible
mistral would constantly log error messages like the following:
2019-05-02 19:14:36.702 8 WARNING oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [-] Unexpected error during heartbeart thread processing, retrying...: amqp.exceptions.ConnectionForced: Too many heartbeats missed

With this change we could not reproduce this issue during a deployment
and no missed heartbeat messages were observed during the deploy.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1826281

Change-Id: Id22b1465d6d2424d90781983b970aba4545feb8a

commit_message:
[queens] re-add ssh firewall rule

When the undercloud isn't containerized,
I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e isn't enough and we need to
add the rule in instack-undercloud.

It was removed in pre-rules: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
to allow more granularity for the operators.
Let's keep the functionality but still allowing ssh by default.

Change-Id: I3a5c1f558ba3ae639857f1a0596a6243a91d49e6
Related-Bug: #1826829

commit_message:
Drop admin endpoints

The admin endpoints offer no special functionality, users may talk to
the public endpoints instead. The only historic use case has been the
keystone v2 admin endpoint, but with keystone v3 API, even that is no
longer needed, except that it's use is hardcoded in keystonemiddleware.
So we prepare everything for completely getting rid of the admin
Identity endpoint, but still create it during bootstrap.

Also drop explicitly creating resources that are created during keystone
bootstrap anyway.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs/src/branch/master/specs/ocata/all/drop-admin-endpoints.rst

commit_message:
Fix elasticsearch version in python requirements

OpenStack Python requirements check fails on Python elasticsearch with error:

 > Requirement for package elasticsearch excludes a version
 > not excluded in the global list.

Change-Id: Iadb5a14d495dbf242970b8b1f4705cd33545a7eb
Closes-Bug: #1826782

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 13:41:53.000000000', 'message': 'Allow dynamic properties on Resource

Some services support "dynamic" (or better to say not standardized 
properties on the resource (i.e. Image). In order to complete switch 
from re-implementation of the requests in cloud/proxy layer we need to 
provide ability to set/read properties not present in the native 
resource definition.
Another use case is setting/retrieving of dynamic header properties 
(i.e. Object)

Change-Id: Ia53d5dfd9047640243a1f101289df1e156ed7624
'}]
commit_message:
Allow dynamic properties on Resource

Some services support "dynamic" (or better to say not standardized 
properties on the resource (i.e. Image). In order to complete switch 
from re-implementation of the requests in cloud/proxy layer we need to 
provide ability to set/read properties not present in the native 
resource definition.
Another use case is setting/retrieving of dynamic header properties 
(i.e. Object)

Change-Id: Ia53d5dfd9047640243a1f101289df1e156ed7624

commit_message:
Plumbing for locking an instance with reason

This patch adds the required plumbing for locking and unlocking
a server with a reason. Note that this will not be used until the
new microversion patch in this series merges.

Related to blueprint add-locked-reason

Change-Id: Id5432b143f298f49a9b8ac1724ef5c200c91501d

commit_message:
Miss node_id in devstack lib

When installing devstack, found there is
a missing node id in devstack/lib/ironic
when root devices are less than 4Gb.

Change-Id: Ie101d1e312bd7820294fad8b317fc62faa8769e1
Story: #1730526
Task: #9773
(cherry picked from commit 4b6fe6668779ea60781f77b94d7d7c4bb9dbae5e)

[{'created': '2019-05-06 05:26:28.000000000', 'message': "Reuse /var/lib/tempest symlink for rpm also

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605980/ with this review in
tripleo, we use /var/lib/tempest path but in kolla tempest
dockerfile /usr/share/openstack-tempest is used which is not
mounted in tripleo deployment.
Let's reuse the same volume with tempest container instead
of /usr/share/openstack-tempest.

Change-Id: I402f58ce53fdce426582cf2fc31349da6d2f5ae0
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b8958459809940b812364542a6994a89624f981)
"}]
commit_message:
Reuse /var/lib/tempest symlink for rpm also

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605980/ with this review in
tripleo, we use /var/lib/tempest path but in kolla tempest
dockerfile /usr/share/openstack-tempest is used which is not
mounted in tripleo deployment.
Let's reuse the same volume with tempest container instead
of /usr/share/openstack-tempest.

Change-Id: I402f58ce53fdce426582cf2fc31349da6d2f5ae0
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b8958459809940b812364542a6994a89624f981)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 15:54:40.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore DrAgentAssociationError in test_remove_add_speaker_agent

The BGP service plugin will automatically re-schedule BGP speakers
that are unscheduled with a periodic job. This introduces a race
condition that the basic scenario test needs to account for. This
change causes the test_remove_add_speaker_agent() test to ignore
DrAgentAssociationError when attempting to explicitly reschedule
a BGP speaker that has just unscheduled. Since the content of the
test is not affected by catching and ignoring these errors, we can
safely ignore the error while enabling the test to pass consistently.

commit_message:
Ignore DrAgentAssociationError in test_remove_add_speaker_agent

The BGP service plugin will automatically re-schedule BGP speakers
that are unscheduled with a periodic job. This introduces a race
condition that the basic scenario test job needs to account for. This
change causes the test_remove_add_speaker_agent() test to ignore
any DrAgentAssociationError when attempting to explicitly reschedule
a BGP speaker that has just unscheduled. Since the content of the
test is not affected by catching and ignoring these errors, we can
safely ignore the error while enabling the test to pass consistently.

Change-Id: I10b11ae52b36552d448cecaea03cfa1baaca026a
Closes-Bug: #1820293

commit_message:
change function list_traces of mongodb module

osprofiler fails when it is configed with mongon.
the minimum version of pymongo osprofile requires is 3.0.2
and in this version and after when function list_traces is
is invoked error will show described in the bug issue.

Change-Id: I2510660c36aaa89117a97c67b4cb61fa3dade14d
Closes-Bug: 1827480

commit_message:
Disable metadata_csum when creating ext4 filesystems

Cirros can't mount a ephemeral partition if its enabled.

Change-Id: I7b56fcd0be1cd48a6b72a0c156d37b3f279a8da9
Story: #2004604
Task: #28499

commit_message:
Retire cloud-init

This was never an official project so no patches against governance are
required.

Change-Id: I91e09035ff829392306fd970aad439fdb18ae1a8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649081

[{'created': '2019-05-03 20:52:05.000000000', 'message': 'add version map for python3.6 to 3.7

This prevents installing unconstrainted versions of libraries for
python3.7.  When it was unmapped there was no constraint for it for

Change-Id: I0a5ecc715142756a9ec37fca559fad691651430c

commit_message:
add version map for python3.6 to 3.7

This prevents installing unconstrainted versions of libraries for
python3.7.  When it was unmapped there was no constraint for it for
certian libraries (some libraries had diferent versions for each version
of python).

Change-Id: I0a5ecc715142756a9ec37fca559fad691651430c

commit_message:
Add openstack/tenks Ansible dependencies

It would be useful if we could depend on pull requests for these
projects so that we can ensure they don't break tenks.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-06 05:45:30.000000000', 'message': "Work around pip errors

As pointed out by ajaeger; the wheel build jobs are failing with

 Error installing 'pip from
 git+https://github.com/ianw/pip.git@path-and-hash#egg=pip': editable
 mode is not supported for pyproject.toml-style projects.

This appears to be an issue with pip 19.0 which would be installed on
the build hosts, interacting with projects that have a pyproject.toml
file.

The problem only seems to be related to installing in editable mode,
which we don't really need here on this ephemeral host.  So just
switch to a regular install, with upgrade/reinstall to be sure.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/6449

Change-Id: I006500a2c98f512176fbac4ab426a8719243fc70
"}, {'created': '2019-05-06 05:46:12.000000000', 'message': "wheel-build: Work around pip 19.0 errors

This appears to be an issue with pip 19.0 which would be installed on
the build hosts, interacting with projects that have a pyproject.toml
file.

The problem only seems to be related to installing in editable mode,
which we don't really need here on this ephemeral host.  So just
switch to a regular install, with upgrade/reinstall to be sure.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/6449

Change-Id: I006500a2c98f512176fbac4ab426a8719243fc70
"}]
commit_message:
wheel-build: Work around pip 19.0 errors

As pointed out by ajaeger; the wheel build jobs are failing with

 Error installing 'pip from
 git+https://github.com/ianw/pip.git@path-and-hash#egg=pip': editable
 mode is not supported for pyproject.toml-style projects.

This appears to be an issue with pip 19.0 which would be installed on
the build hosts, interacting with projects that have a pyproject.toml
file.

The problem only seems to be related to installing in editable mode,
which we don't really need here on this ephemeral host.  So just
switch to a regular install, with upgrade/reinstall to be sure.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/6449

Change-Id: I006500a2c98f512176fbac4ab426a8719243fc70

commit_message:
Skip building new collect-logs role during pkg build

Since collect-logs role is moved to a new repo from tqe. It
should not be built during package build process.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/998

Change-Id: Iea28bfa830ee51721cfb590e2099fcdbe0b5be88
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add option to modify ceph parameters in standalone

Running standlone with a custom registry requires
setting non-standard parameters for ceph.
This review adds the option to modify the ceph
parameters.

The option will default to false and the step
will be skipped in a standard deployment.

"}, {'created': '2019-04-03 08:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Introduce tempest_services var for installing tempest_plugins

Currently in os_tempest, there are multiple vars available like
tempest_service_available_{service_name}
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest
/tree/defaults/main.yml#n159 in defaults/main.yml for installing
tempest plugins and create pre tempest resouces for them. Their
values are controlled based on openstack-ansible group vars but
in tripleo we configure services using tripleo heat templates
Which makes it hard for us to auto set the value of these
os_tempest vars.

In order to make it easier for our consumption, we are using
tempest_services var which can be used in zuul job featureset
override to enable any service. but default it is disabled.

Adding tempest_services:
         - 'cinder'
         - 'neutron'
will install the respective services.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/954

Change-Id: I709c04cdffbc03e4d264a4ff116a8743e402473d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce tempest_services var for installing tempest_plugins

Currently in os_tempest, there are multiple vars available like
tempest_service_available_{service_name}
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest
/tree/defaults/main.yml#n159 in defaults/main.yml for installing
tempest plugins and create pre tempest resouces for them. Their
values are controlled based on openstack-ansible group vars but
in tripleo we configure services using tripleo heat templates
Which makes it hard for us to auto set the value of these
os_tempest vars.

In order to make it easier for our consumption, we are using
tempest_services var which can be used in zuul job featureset
override to enable any service. but default it is disabled.

Adding tempest_services:
         - 'cinder'
         - 'neutron'
will install the respective services.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/954

Change-Id: I709c04cdffbc03e4d264a4ff116a8743e402473d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-04-16 08:01:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use /var/lib/tempest symlink for tempest container

Currently with in tempest Dockerfile, we have two symlink
/usr/share/openstack and /var/lib/tempest, we cannot create
two symlink for a single directory. It is causing failure to
build container using buildah.

Change-Id: I402f58ce53fdce426582cf2fc31349da6d2f5ae0
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-17 06:30:53.000000000', 'message': "Reuse /var/lib/tempest symlink for rpm also

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605980/ with this review in
tripleo, we use /var/lib/tempest path but in kolla tempest
dockerfile /usr/share/openstack-tempest is used which is not
mounted in tripleo deployment.
Let's reuse the same volume with tempest container instead
of /usr/share/openstack-tempest.

Change-Id: I402f58ce53fdce426582cf2fc31349da6d2f5ae0
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Reuse /var/lib/tempest symlink for rpm also

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605980/ with this review in
tripleo, we use /var/lib/tempest path but in kolla tempest
dockerfile /usr/share/openstack-tempest is used which is not
mounted in tripleo deployment.
Let's reuse the same volume with tempest container instead
of /usr/share/openstack-tempest.

Change-Id: I402f58ce53fdce426582cf2fc31349da6d2f5ae0
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8289, 'date': '2019-03-14 01:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-03-14 05:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-03-14 07:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-03-14 09:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-03-15 10:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please kindly add a release note too:)

in [1], it jumps the microversion to 2.5, which means we gonna break anyone who uses microversion < 2.5.

IMO the better solution here is to add a filter to check the version like [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Ia57724c231c10efad9cee46be4969fa276fff8b1
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py#L912'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-16 11:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-16 11:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Please kindly add a release note too:)
 > 
 > in [1], it jumps the microversion to 2.5, which means we gonna
 > break anyone who uses microversion < 2.5.
 > 
 > IMO the better solution here is to add a filter to check the
 > version like [2].
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Ia57724c231c10efad9cee46be4969fa276fff8b1
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py#L912

release note added. The Octavia doesn't support microversion, i'm not sure it's easy to do the similar check as Nova."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-03-20 03:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Since there's no easy way to know which API version Octavia currently is (is it?), The only way here is to hope Octavia keep maintain the backward support for the rest V2 like [1] and [2]. And since [2] is not there for earlier Octavia version, What we can trust is Octavia handle it's unrelated param correctly.

What will happen when we give a new parameter which is not supported by API (let's said if we pass a param `new_param` or pass `tags` in earlier API service)?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/api-ref/source/v2/member.inc#request-1
[2] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/api/drivers/utils.py#L90"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-03-20 03:51:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM

As the property mentions that it's supported from 12.0 , I guess it's fine. AFAICT, Octavia minor versioning is for internal tracking for newer releases as they don't have api mircoversion support yet. There is no check in octavia client side to not allow random attributes."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-20 05:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Since there's no easy way to know which API version Octavia
 > currently is (is it?), The only way here is to hope Octavia keep
 > maintain the backward support for the rest V2 like [1] and [2]. And
 > since [2] is not there for earlier Octavia version, What we can
 > trust is Octavia handle it's unrelated param correctly.
 > 
 > What will happen when we give a new parameter which is not
 > supported by API (let's said if we pass a param `new_param` or pass
 > `tags` in earlier API service)?

If you pass an unsupported param, the request will fail. 

    $ cat <<EOF | http -b post ${octavia_prefix}/lbaas/loadbalancers X-Auth-Token:$token
    > {
    >     "loadbalancer": {
    >         "name": "test_tag",
    >         "vip_subnet_id": "7e5398da-a77a-4d5a-a2ae-f1273132f869",
    >         "tags": ["test"],
    >         "unsupported": ""
    >     }
    > }
    > EOF
    {
        "debuginfo": null,
        "faultcode": "Client",
        "faultstring": "Unknown attribute for argument load_balancer.loadbalancer: unsupported"
    }

I've already mentioned both in the release note and the property description that this new property only works with Octavia Stein or newer version.

I'm wondering for a new API parameter like this, do we have a best practice in Heat? What's your suggestion?'}, {'account_id': 29759, 'date': '2019-03-20 06:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-03-20 06:42:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm fine with this patch, I only not + the workflow because we already pass the feature freeze, and releasing RC1. I can bring this up to the team meeting today and hope we can provide you any good news

For the version support, I don't think we have a clear suggestion here since we don't even have a nice way to check with the API version.
A workaround would be to retry and strip `tags` when we got property error with it.
We can even do that in following up patch."}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-03-20 06:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-03-20 06:59:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

cool beans!"}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-03-21 11:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-03-21 11:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2019-05-05 08:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'Do not judge whether the quota is over-limit in the allowed method on CreateSnapshot

The allowed method in createsnapshot calls the interface of the cinder service.
If there are 10 volumes, it will be called 10 times,
which has an impact on the access speed of the volume page.

This patch removes the service interface used in the allowed method.

Change-Id: Ic3f75ec38aff1c5e28c4c45b6f42d5f6e4b743ed
Closes-Bug: #1827766

of the cinder service. If there are 10 volumes,

commit_message:
Do not judge whether the quota is over-limit in the allowed method

The allowed method in createsnapshot calls the interface
of the cinder service. If there are 10 volumes,
it will be called 10 times,
which has an impact on the access speed of the volume page.

This patch removes the service interface used in the allowed method.

Change-Id: Ic3f75ec38aff1c5e28c4c45b6f42d5f6e4b743ed
Closes-Bug: #1827766

commit_message:
ceph: deploy OpenStack Stein for Ceph Mimic

In stable/mimic, we want a stable version of OpenStack which is Stein
right now.
There are plans to deploy Nautilus in Train, so let's deploy Stein when a
patch is sent to puppet-ceph stable/mimic.

Change-Id: I801a486f8ccc8e7e3db6d3562278f177a014dd5a

MANIFEST files aren't needed when using pbr, while the Makefiles have

docs).

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix spare amphora failover

Failover of spare amphorae failed with an exception,
because they're not attached to any loadbalancer.

This commit fixes this issue, allowing to rotate/update
spare amphora images.

Story: 2005470
Task: 30549

Change-Id: I9c9002486a9a547a215514c24ccb95f039b23ec2
(cherry picked from commit a509710a7faf5c643377d1593a2591d37f3e8390)

commit_message:
Run nova-tox-functional-py36 in the placement gate

This requires some slight adjustsments to the job in nova,
found in the depends-on.

The result of this will be _this_ placement change running
against nova master.

In order to blacklist the api_sample_tests (to save some time)
the job is inherited and some args are added to the tox command.

Story: 2005562
Task: 30746
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/657074
Change-Id: I72ae7f552879be13777fea90fa7055e056d309a7

subject: Don't use node count from failed stack parameters
messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-05-05 15:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-03 21:40:39.000000000', 'message': "Don't use node count from failed stack parameters

While checking node count in predeploy validations, if the stack
is in FAILED state, parameters may not represent the actual nodes
in stack. Don't use them for validations.

Change-Id: I12213909a47e0a186bdb2e06c58784457bfe8d13
Closes-Bug: #1826925
(cherry picked from commit 4fe901d2d079a71f0e1bb91aa3dfd0f486cba30c)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use node count from failed stack parameters

While checking node count in predeploy validations, if the stack
is in FAILED state, parameters may not represent the actual nodes
in stack. Don't use them for validations.

Change-Id: I12213909a47e0a186bdb2e06c58784457bfe8d13
Closes-Bug: #1826925
(cherry picked from commit 4fe901d2d079a71f0e1bb91aa3dfd0f486cba30c)

commit_message:
libvirt: Always disconnect volumes after libvirtError exceptions

Building on Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760 we should always
attempt to disconnect volumes from the host when exceptions are thrown
while attempting to attach a volume to a domain. This was previously
done for generic exceptions but not for libvirtError exceptions.

Closes-Bug: #1826523
Change-Id: If21230869826c992e7d0398434b9a4b255940213
(cherry picked from commit 091a910576d9b580678f1881fffa425ab4632f48)
(cherry picked from commit 048d5b790f3da2756a0a1bf2bc015812cb24d53a)

commit_message:
libvirt: Stop ignoring unknown libvirtError exceptions during volume attach

Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a attempted to introduce a
simple breadcrumb in the logs to highlight a known Libvirt issue.
Unfortunately this change resulted in libvirtError exceptions that
didn't match the known issue being silently ignored.

This change corrects this by using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception
to ensure all libvirtError exceptions are logged and raised regardless
of being linked to the known issue.

Change-Id: Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760
Closes-Bug: #1825882
(cherry picked from commit bc57ae50734fa6a70115b6369e867079fb5eb4b8)
(cherry picked from commit b3dedefcc58a1fc76ba37f9f8bb1ef7d238aaceb)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia93aa434f703a90b883e05cf2c89a5eb5887c326

commit_message:
Added check to ensure template usage

This patch adds a check to make sure common project templates
are used as well as addresses a few which had problems.

Ideally, this patch would depend on openstack-zuul-jobs and
check all templates from there, but that should be done in
a follow-up change.

Change-Id: Iac7729978b574a6274062b3488daef5b3facad87

required by ceph-nautilus. lvcreate command fails

To overcome this let's add a direct dependency on 'lvm2'
package as lvm_create task needs that package, in addition
adds a sleep task of 5 seconds.

(cherry picked from commit ed4b1af4d163ae4c969018720cf2fc0bf0657fca)

commit_message:
Handle lvcreate failure by ensuring dep on lvm2

[1] added lvm_create task to create a lvm device
required by ceph-nautilus. lvcreate command fails
some times with below Error:-
/dev/ceph_vg/lv_data: not found: device not cleared

To overcome this let's add a direct dependency on 'lvm2'
package as lvm_create task needs that package, in addition
adds a sleep task of 5 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650281

Change-Id: I61b6c353cb5216265bf31d56a9f40437821b92fc
(cherry picked from commit ed4b1af4d163ae4c969018720cf2fc0bf0657fca)

subject: Use oslo_messaging_rpc_port for nova rpc healthchecks
messages: [{'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-05-04 17:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-05-05 14:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-04 17:23:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo_messaging_rpc_port for nova rpc healthchecks

With 405366fa32583e88c34417e5f46fa574ed8f4e98 the parameters RpcPort,
RpcUserName, RpcPassword and RpcUseSSL got deprecated and
nova::rabbitmq_port removed. As a result the healtcheck get called with
null parameter and fail.
We now get the global_config_settings from RabbitMQService and use
oslo_messaging_rpc_port for the healthcheck.

This is an addition to 8ff04029f5bc4cc2db4b3575229ce7bafb4eb358 for
the undercloud compute service.

Related-Bug: #1824805

Change-Id: Ic5f545b3bda571e028452d5c4123d9eca4493054
(cherry picked from commit 372ca22483a1988a363b9ed8ab0ef319b1ab0f16)
'}]
commit_message:
Use oslo_messaging_rpc_port for nova rpc healthchecks

With 405366fa32583e88c34417e5f46fa574ed8f4e98 the parameters RpcPort,
RpcUserName, RpcPassword and RpcUseSSL got deprecated and
nova::rabbitmq_port removed. As a result the healtcheck get called with
null parameter and fail.
We now get the global_config_settings from RabbitMQService and use
oslo_messaging_rpc_port for the healthcheck.

This is an addition to 8ff04029f5bc4cc2db4b3575229ce7bafb4eb358 for
the undercloud compute service.

Related-Bug: #1824805

Change-Id: Ic5f545b3bda571e028452d5c4123d9eca4493054
(cherry picked from commit 372ca22483a1988a363b9ed8ab0ef319b1ab0f16)

Add support for Senlin

commit_message:
Resolve puppet overwriting a pre-existing bootstrap-osd auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. puppet-ceph has been overwriting this keyring in memory and
on the filesystem. This patch updates ceph::osd to exract the
client keyring from memory and write it to the filesystem. This will
means ceph::key will not need to create the client.bootstrap-osd keyring.

Change-Id: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
Partial-bug: 1769722
(cherry picked from commit d833c03b975c922a28281918a2ac71a3dd7a2104)

commit_message:
Resolve puppet overwriting a pre-existing bootstrap-osd auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. puppet-ceph has been overwriting this keyring in memory and
on the filesystem. This patch updates ceph::osd to exract the
client keyring from memory and write it to the filesystem. This will
means ceph::key will not need to create the client.bootstrap-osd keyring.

Change-Id: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
Partial-bug: 1769722
(cherry picked from commit d833c03b975c922a28281918a2ac71a3dd7a2104)

commit_message:
Make nova-tox-functional-py36 reusable

We'd like placement to be able to run this job itself. Instead of
duplicating it, we can simply use it directly. However, according
to discussions with the infra gang, to ensure that works properly
we need to make openstack/nova a required project and explicitly
set zuul_work_dir. These are the default values already when
used from nova itself.

Change-Id: I73f9dacd912331d209a6fa04eaf5591d94d720f2
Story: 2005562

commit_message:
Run ansible before scale down

This patch modifies the scale workbook, to add a new workflow which
runs Ansible tasks before removing the servers during a scale down.

blueprint scale-down-tasks
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 28245, 'date': '2019-05-04 13:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-04 13:36:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Enable Podman Service For Lacking Roles

ComputeOvsDpdkSriov, ComputeOvsDpdkSriovRT and CellController roles do
not include OS::TripleO::Services::Podman which may cause Overcloud deployments to
fail.

Adding Podman service to these roles in order to be aligned with the rest of the roles.

Change-Id: If9b9ffa4651133b966ea0c28069dd1a81f3b2df5

commit_message:
Fix listener API handling of None/null updates

The current listener API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as connection-limit,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the listener parameters.

Change-Id: I41c9bedd8a3452513af3d409fbacd65ea287f02a
Story: 2005374
Task: 30352
(cherry picked from commit 930a3236bf7fd341b32ba41b2c99cd3ad832d709)

commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check for minimum required cinder API version

The compute API has required cinder API >= 3.44 since Queens [1] for
working with the volume attachments API as part of the wider
volume multi-attach support.

In order to start removing the compatibility code in the compute API
this change adds an upgrade check for the minimum required cinder API
version (3.44).

[1] Ifc01dbf98545104c998ab96f65ff8623a6db0f28

Change-Id: Ic9d1fb364e06e08250c7c5d7d4bdb956cb60e678

> should we prepare a release note for this?

I should perhaps mark this as a WIP as it's not something we really want to merge without further discussion on the timing and other implications.

On the other hand, it is something we need to make happen relatively soon as some of the packagers need placement deleted from nova before they are able to package placement as its own thing.

But yes, when the time comes, this needs a release note. The reason I hadn't included one yet is because I wasn't sure what it needed to say (because of the aforementioned details). I really only meant to the end of this week, thinking it would be easier for rcNs to have things backported to them before this merged. Not that these changes make a huge difference in complexity.

I'm still at a loss as to how keeping this code in master until the PTG makes any difference to operators, since we kept in in Stein to give them a whole cycle to make the update."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-26 20:35:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 34:

> I'm still at a loss as to how keeping this code in master until the PTG makes any difference to operators, since we kept in in Stein to give them a whole cycle to make the update.

The majority of deployment tools aren't even deploying extracted placement yet, nor are their packages for some distros (ubuntu right? probably also suse), so yeah the code is in Stein for upgrading and all but no deployment tools are even close to using the extracted stuff yet in production so let's give some time for those tools to catch up before dropping what they are using today."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2019-03-26 21:15:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 34:

@Matt: sorry, I don't mean to beat this to death, but how does having or deleting code in Train master affect deployment tools that are so far behind? They certainly aren't working with bleeding edge master. 

TBC, I'm fine with leaving it; the reasoning just seems strange, that's all."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

Apologies if this is a stupid question but have we agreed *when* this will be approved during Summit/Forum/PTG?

I only ask as Martin (TripleO) and I are only in DEN from Thursday for the PTG. We would like to give the RDO folks who are already in DEN a heads up if this is going to land before our arrival (during the night in EMEA) as builds will break until the final removal change [1] lands. FWIW the remaining TripleO and RDO CI *should* remain stable given we've switched over to placement-api by default and mostly removed any reference to the the nova-placement-api service [2].

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/16234/ (This can't land until the Placement code is removed from openstack/nova)
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:tripleo-nova-placement-removal+(status:open+OR+status:merged)"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-29 23:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

someone else will do that.

"}, {'created': '2018-11-19 18:07:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Delete the placement code

This is a pass at removing the placement code from nova to see what
breaks and also to help validate the use of external placement for
tests (the parent patch of this one).

Note that the libvirt.test_driver.TestUpdateProviderTree test has
been entirely removed because it uses resource provider objects
directly. A separate patch is pending at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618786/ to address this.

nova-status has had the count resource providers check removed: it
relies on direct access to the placement database which we
presumably do not wish to require. We'll need some other way to
accomplish the same thing, if it is still required.

Similarly the migration that calls
consumer_obj.create_incomplete_consumers in nova-manage has been
removed. Not sure of the correct way to deal with that, but
presumably, by Stein people will have already done that migration?

placement-related configuration is not (yet) updated as there are
multiple types of placement conf: configuration for placement
itself, and configuration for using placement.

Docs have been somewhat updated, to remove errors, but not to
completely correct them. user and contributor docs remain, but as
stubs with links to the new locations. Install and upgrade
documentation is not (yet) updated as that will require more
significant changes on the placement.  Policy doc handling for
placement is removed. Documentation tuning will likely require a
series of changes on both sides (nova and placement) and plenty of
human iteration to get it right. Getting it right in one fell swoop
is unlikely.

This needs to depend on the devstack change with the
external placement.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162

Change-Id: I4181f39dea7eb10b84e6f5057938767b3e422aff

placement is removed. Documentation tuning will likely require a
series of changes on both sides (nova and placement) and plenty of
human iteration to get it right. Getting it right in one fell swoop
is unlikely.

This needs to depend on the devstack change with the
external placement.

Depends-On: I0b217e7a8c68a637b7a3445f6c44b7574117e320
Change-Id: I4181f39dea7eb10b84e6f5057938767b3e422aff
"}, {'created': '2018-12-10 19:38:49.000000000', 'message': "Delete the placement code

This is a pass at removing the placement code from nova to see what
breaks and also to help validate the use of external placement for
tests (the parent patch of this one).

nova-status has had the count resource providers check removed: it
relies on direct access to the placement database which we
presumably do not wish to require. We'll need some other way to
accomplish the same thing, if it is still required.

Similarly the migration that calls
consumer_obj.create_incomplete_consumers in nova-manage has been
removed. Not sure of the correct way to deal with that, but
presumably, by Stein people will have already done that migration?

placement-related configuration is not (yet) updated as there are
multiple types of placement conf: configuration for placement
itself, and configuration for using placement.

Docs have been somewhat updated, to remove errors, but not to
completely correct them. user and contributor docs remain, but as
stubs with links to the new locations. Install and upgrade
documentation is not (yet) updated as that will require more
significant changes on the placement.  Policy doc handling for
placement is removed. Documentation tuning will likely require a
series of changes on both sides (nova and placement) and plenty of
human iteration to get it right. Getting it right in one fell swoop
is unlikely.

This needs to depend on the devstack change with the
external placement.

Depends-On: I0b217e7a8c68a637b7a3445f6c44b7574117e320
Change-Id: I4181f39dea7eb10b84e6f5057938767b3e422aff

"}, {'created': '2019-01-03 11:55:46.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the placement code

This is the first in a series of changes to remove the placement
code from nova. This change primarily removes code and makes
minor fixes to the docs (to remove errors) and test tooling.
Major changes to documentation, notably install and upgrade
documentation, will follow.

A database migration that calls
consumer_obj.create_incomplete_consumers in nova-manage has been
removed. Not sure of the correct way to deal with that, but
presumably, by Stein people will have already done that migration?

placement-related configuration is not (yet) updated as there are
multiple types of placement conf: configuration for placement
itself, and configuration for using placement.

tox.ini is updated to remove the group_regex required by the
placement gabbi tests. This should probably have gone when the
placement functional tests went, but was overlooked.

A release note is added as a placeholder. It's not clear how much
detail is required. Do we want to explain the various reasons why in
the note or is it sufficient to say "it's happened"?

Documentation tuning will likely require a
series of changes on both sides (nova and placement) and plenty of
human iteration to get it right. Getting it right in one fell swoop
is unlikely.

Change-Id: I4181f39dea7eb10b84e6f5057938767b3e422aff

'}, {'created': '2019-03-23 11:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the placement code

This finalizes the removal of the placement code from nova.
This change primarily removes code and makes fixes to cmd,
test and migration tooling to adapt to the removal.

Placement tests and documention were already removed in
early patches.

A database migration that calls
consumer_obj.create_incomplete_consumers in nova-manage has been
removed.

opts which are relevant on the nova side. This mostly means
ksa-related opts. placement-database configuration is removed
from nova/conf/database.

tox.ini is updated to remove the group_regex required by the
placement gabbi tests. This should probably have gone when the
placement functional tests went, but was overlooked.

A release note is added which describes that this is cleanup,
the main action already happened.

commit_message:
Delete the placement code

This finalizes the removal of the placement code from nova.
This change primarily removes code and makes fixes to cmd,
test and migration tooling to adapt to the removal.

Placement tests and documention were already removed in
early patches.

A database migration that calls
consumer_obj.create_incomplete_consumers in nova-manage has been
removed.

A functional test which confirms the default incomplete
consumer user and project id has been changes so its its use of
conf.placement.incomplete_* (now removed) is replaced with a
constant. The placement server, running in the functional
test, provides its own config.

placement-related configuration is updated to only register those
opts which are relevant on the nova side. This mostly means
ksa-related opts. placement-database configuration is removed
from nova/conf/database.

tox.ini is updated to remove the group_regex required by the
placement gabbi tests. This should probably have gone when the
placement functional tests went, but was overlooked.

A release note is added which describes that this is cleanup,
the main action already happened, but points people to the
nova to placement upgrade instructions in case they haven't
done it yet.

Change-Id: I4181f39dea7eb10b84e6f5057938767b3e422aff

Ivan, we don't have any functional tests for os-brick just yet.   That can be a follow up.  Cinder can't test this just yet either, because currently Cinder won't allow a volume extend call on an attached volume.   We need this to land, and get released, then we can work on the nova and cinder changes needed to make this happen."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2016-01-13 19:09:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-13 21:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Verified+1

This patch adds the new extend_volume API to the connector objects.

commit_message:
os-brick add extend_volume API

This patch adds the new extend_volume API to the connector objects.
The purpose of this patch is to add the ability to notify the host
kernel when an attached volume has been resized.   This allows both
raw device paths and multipath devices to get new sizes on the fly
without detaching and then reattaching to the host.

Cinder Spec:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243730/

To manually test:
  Use the brick_resize.py tool here:
  https://github.com/WaltHP/diediedie/blob/master/diediedie/brick_resize.py

  sample brick.conf to output debug logging for the brick_resize.py tool
  https://gist.github.com/WaltHP/e9b71e0ea1b1d9097762

  After a successful resize, find the virt domain name
  then run
  virsh blockresize <domain name> <path to raw device> <new size>
  for example,
  blockresize instance-00000007 /dev/disk/by-id/dm-uuid-mpath-350002ace1dda383d 3145728

Implements blueprint: brick-extend-attached-volume

Change-Id: I19858dd47afe3bdb3dd25c1dfead732a804cdee2

Building on Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760 we should always

done for generic exceptions but not for libvirtError exceptions.

commit_message:
libvirt: Always disconnect volumes after libvirtError exceptions

Building on Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760 we should always
attempt to disconnect volumes from the host when exceptions are thrown
while attempting to attach a volume to a domain. This was previously
done for generic exceptions but not for libvirtError exceptions.

Closes-Bug: #1826523
Change-Id: If21230869826c992e7d0398434b9a4b255940213

commit_message:
Do not use o_tmpfile_supported() in kvfile.py

kvfile.py does not use linkat(), no need to check for support

Change-Id: Ida96518a70987c81756229819ed3edebf70c62af

subject: Redirect missing project page for openstack-charms
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-03 14:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-03 14:57:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Why not fix this in the project navigator?

We should have the same problem for other project teams like OpenStackAnsible, don't we?"}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-03 15:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Why not fix this in the project navigator?
 > 
 > We should have the same problem for other project teams like
 > OpenStackAnsible, don't we?

openstack-ansible has the "normal" project doc structure, so it's reachable from docs.o.o/openstack-ansible. From the user perspective I would also expect a web page under the project name, so it's easier to find. 
As I saw in the project navigator template there is only  a variable for the link like "project-name"'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-03 18:05:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks like Andreas' question has been addressed so I guess this is good to go"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-05 06:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-02 09:09:50.000000000', 'message': 'Port puppet-glance-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest

Previously Tripleo validate-tempest role was used to run tempest
on tripleo jobs. Recently we are moving to os_tempest (an unified
role developed by openstack-ansible team).

It moves the vars to os_tempest.
Below is the other var changes:

run_tempest: false -> to disable validate-tempest role
use_os_tempest: true -> enable os_tempest
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist

Change-Id: Ic6ffd3093a7f1b5e40af8c74272aba549f21abac
'}]
commit_message:
Port puppet-glance-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest

Previously Tripleo validate-tempest role was used to run tempest
on tripleo jobs. Recently we are moving to os_tempest (an unified
role developed by openstack-ansible team).

It moves the vars to os_tempest.
Below is the other var changes:

run_tempest: false -> to disable validate-tempest role
use_os_tempest: true -> enable os_tempest
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist

Change-Id: Ic6ffd3093a7f1b5e40af8c74272aba549f21abac

commit_message:
Improve metadata performance

Save many requests to the neutron service if the provider
has recently been queried.

Commit 622a845b757aa35932f703963beffc764d8ae244 has the details
about the provider support. The caching helps improve this
support as the neutron service will not be queried many times.

Closes-Bug: #1810642

Change-Id: I19054fae14f95dc3ea73efde45df7e1a59086b44

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-03 12:55:57.000000000', 'message': "Handle lvcreate failure by ensuring dep on lvm2

[1] added lvm_create task to create a lvm device
required by ceph-nautilus. lvcreate command fails
some times with below Error:-
/dev/ceph_vg/lv_data: not found: device not cleared

To overcome this let's add a direct dependency on 'lvm2'
package as lvm_create task needs that package, in addition
adds a sleep task of 5 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650281

Change-Id: I61b6c353cb5216265bf31d56a9f40437821b92fc
"}]
commit_message:
Handle lvcreate failure by ensuring dep on lvm2

[1] added lvm_create task to create a lvm device
required by ceph-nautilus. lvcreate command fails
some times with below Error:-
/dev/ceph_vg/lv_data: not found: device not cleared

To overcome this let's add a direct dependency on 'lvm2'
package as lvm_create task needs that package, in addition
adds a sleep task of 5 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650281

Change-Id: I61b6c353cb5216265bf31d56a9f40437821b92fc

subject: suport multi discovery service
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-18 03:28:46.000000000', 'message': 'suport multi discovery service

magnum will try to use discovery url in following order:
1. discovery url which is passed when create a cluster
2. discovery service endpoint in configuration
3. if configurated discovery endpoint is differnent from
   "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" and,
   use "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" as a backup
   service

Change-Id: Ia0193b5f1e902a8f5295baa54abb644d768131be
Task: 26938
'}]
commit_message:
suport multi discovery service

magnum will try to use discovery url in following order:
1. discovery url which is passed when create a cluster
2. discovery service endpoint in configuration
3. if configurated discovery endpoint is differnent from
   "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" and,
   use "https://discovery.etcd.io/new?size=%(size)d" as a backup
   service

Change-Id: Ia0193b5f1e902a8f5295baa54abb644d768131be
Task: 26938

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-30 13:06:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use findmnt for verify partition

Removing mount/grep/cut combo in favor of single powerful
findmnt command.

Example:
test:~$ findmnt -n -o SOURCE --source LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs
/dev/vda1
test:~$ findmnt -n -o TARGET --source /dev/vda1
/

Change-Id: Idde0be920bb6a9be534d4c17e0ca98da2beff342
'}, {'created': '2019-04-30 15:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use findmnt for verify partition

Removing mount/grep/cut combo in favor of single powerful
findmnt command.
Also using proper option for blkid.

Example:
test:~$ sudo blkid -L cloudimg-rootfs
/dev/vda1
test:~$ sudo findmnt -n -o TARGET --source /dev/vda1
/

Change-Id: Idde0be920bb6a9be534d4c17e0ca98da2beff342
'}, {'created': '2019-05-01 09:30:48.000000000', 'message': 'Improve verify partition

Removing mount/grep/cut combo in favor of single powerful
findmnt command.
Also using proper options for blkid.

Example:
test:~$ sudo /sbin/blkid -c /dev/null -o device -t LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs
/dev/vda1
test:~$ sudo findmnt -n -o TARGET --source /dev/vda1
/

Change-Id: Idde0be920bb6a9be534d4c17e0ca98da2beff342
'}, {'created': '2019-05-03 10:04:52.000000000', 'message': 'Using proper options for blkid.

We can use blikd options to get the device path.

Example:
test:~$ sudo /sbin/blkid -c /dev/null -o device -t LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs
/dev/vda1

Change-Id: Idde0be920bb6a9be534d4c17e0ca98da2beff342
'}]
commit_message:
Using proper options for blkid.

We can use blikd options to get the device path.

Example:
test:~$ sudo /sbin/blkid -c /dev/null -o device -t LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs
/dev/vda1

Change-Id: Idde0be920bb6a9be534d4c17e0ca98da2beff342

commit_message:
Prevent "qbr" Linux Bridge from replying to ARP messages

The Linux Bridge in between the VM TAP interface and OVS should [1][2]:
- Reply only if the target IP address is local address configured
  on the incoming interface.
- Always use the best local address.

[1]http://kb.linuxvirtualserver.org/wiki/Using_arp_announce/arp_ignore_to_disable_ARP
[2]http://linux-ip.net/html/ether-arp.html#ether-arp-flux

Change-Id: I8721b680bbd9f59a67bd8e6855ffb291c208cdb8
Closes-Bug: #1825888

[{'created': '2019-05-04 21:01:28.000000000', 'message': "Disable image validation

In before, Zun validate the container's image before lauching
the container. The goal is to have a pre-flight check before
doing an expensive operation.

However, this feature has several disadvantages:
* It blocks the zun api server on validating the image
* It relies on API call to external image registry (i.e. DockerHub),
  so it is not reliable.

This commit changes the default configuration to disable image
validation by default.

Change-Id: I67ad3fd69bc7680fb565bfc138bc0d8b77157649

commit_message:
Disable image validation

In before, Zun validate the container's image before lauching
the container. The goal is to have a pre-flight check before
doing an expensive operation.

However, this feature has several disadvantages:
* It blocks the zun api server on validating the image
* It relies on API call to external image registry (i.e. DockerHub),
  so it is not reliable.

This commit changes the default configuration to disable image
validation by default.

Change-Id: I67ad3fd69bc7680fb565bfc138bc0d8b77157649

commit_message:
Fix KeyError when image was deleted

KeyError was raised when volume was created from image and
then this image is deleted. THis patch adds additional check
to avoid such situations.

Change-Id: I85712fd9587d8815d2f3c74227ded9a4f62296f3

commit_message:
Correct the environment template clone error message

When cloning environment template with the same name, the
current exception description is "Environment with specified name
already exists", "Environment" in the exception description
should be "Env template".

Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iaf5868c173963eb737e27c2a3221f6b6a23fac84

commit_message:
Get the instance.image using the get method

After creating an instance in the way of creating a new volume,
delete the used image first, then access the instance page,
and an error message is shown.

This patch use the get method to get image

Change-Id: I0998136f6e1c0a37fe39fc2c54a3a106cd24c7d1
Closes-Bug: #1826690

commit_message:
Remove ovs-ofctl after 5 develop cycles

It was marked as deprecated after Ocata Design Summit [1],
and mostly because it is really inefficient at sacle. So
let's remove it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/424953/

Change-Id: Ibaa8ec2270d4fe76f20c55218ee6af9d2b7d38c0

The patch set 10 fixed the bug.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-12-27 10:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-12-27 11:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

This looks ready to me.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:49:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

I'm wondering if we could do better than check on the file name.

1/ we can assume that if the process IS NOT on an object-server, we need to run legacy mode
2/ we can assume that if the process IS on an object-server, we need to run new mode
3/ can we check the content of the config (like pipeline variable) to check if this is an object-server or not"}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2019-02-18 10:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

Pete, Romain, thank you for your reviews.

> 3/ can we check the content of the config (like pipeline variable) to check if this is an object-server or not

I think checking config with its content will be complicated.

AFAIK, except for pipeline, any variables are optional. So only pipeline variable can be used from config content.

If we check a config with its pipeline variable, we need to check pipeline members contains object-server or not. Because both of object-server.conf and object-expirer.conf contains pipeline variable.

If I understand correctly, pipeline variable names are editable.
It means that following object-server.conf can exist.

=== object-server.conf ===
[pipeline:main]
pipeline = healthcheck recon obj-sv

[app:obj-sv]
use = egg:swift#object
==========================

So the pipeline check requires check of egg. But it depends on egg settings. The implementation will be complicated.


How about following behavior?

Case 1: conf file path contains "object-expirer"
  - The expirer run as legacy mode.

Case 2: conf file path contains "object-server"
  - The expirer's mode depends on "dequeue_from_legacy" setting.
  - "dequeue_from_legacy"'s default is false.

Case 3: otherwise (e.g. "object-expiration.conf", "obj-sv.conf")
  - The expirer's mode depends on "dequeue_from_legacy" setting.
  - "dequeue_from_legacy"'s default is **true** for backward compatibility.
  - If the default value is used, the fact is logged as warn-log.
      - The log message will be
        """
        Object-expirer's `dequeue_from_legacy` value is not set in the conf file.
        It runs with `dequeue_from_legacy == True` for backward compatibility.
        It means that the object-expirer's configuration may be in the style of object-expirer.conf.
        Object-expirer.conf style is deprecated. Move the configuration into object-server.conf.
        If you want suppress this warning, set `dequeue_from_legacy` explicitly.
        """
      - Any other message ideas are welcome :)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-03-27 21:32:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

i don't really understand how this works - if I'm confused please ignore me"}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2019-03-27 21:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

Ok, I understand the reasoning for this option being the way it is.

Operators will want to "migrate" expirer to object layer but many object nodes will not run in legacy mode.

If you currently run with n_proccesses = 24 and you have 64 object nodes you probably want to migrate those options to 24 of the 64 object nodes and turn dequeue_from_legacy to false on the rest.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-05-02 20:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

I found it akward to have to deal with the processes/process option(s) and ALSO the dequeue_from_legacy option...

I want to look at the follow up patch incase I missed something that maybe should get pulled out into a earlier patch, but that could probably that can be follow-up...

I don't think I have any reason not merge this. '}, {'created': '2019-03-29 04:38:57.000000000', 'message': 'Enable to configure object-expirer in object-server.conf

To prepare for object-expirer's general task queue feature [1],
this patch enables to configure object-expirer in object-server.conf.
Object-expirer.conf can be used in the same manner as before, but deprecated.

If both of object-server.conf with "object-expirer" section and
object-expirer.conf are in a node, only object-server.conf is used.
Object-expirer.conf is used only if all object-server.conf doesn't have
"object-expirer" section.

There are two differences between "object-expirer.conf" style and
"object-server.conf" style.

The first difference is `dequeue_from_legacy` default value.
`dequeue_from_legacy` defines task queue mode. In "object-expirer.conf"
style, the default mode is legacy queue. In "object-server.conf" style,
the default mode is general queue. But general mode means no-op mode
for now, because general task queue is not implemented yet.

The second difference is internal client config. In "object-expirer.conf"
style, config file of internal client is the object-expirer.conf itself.
In "object-server.conf" style, config file of internal client is
another file.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389/

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: Ib21568f9b9d8547da87a99d65ae73a550e9c3230

commit_message:
Enable to configure object-expirer in object-server.conf

To prepare for object-expirer's general task queue feature [1],
this patch enables to configure object-expirer in object-server.conf.
Object-expirer.conf can be used in the same manner as before, but deprecated.

If both of object-server.conf with "object-expirer" section and
object-expirer.conf are in a node, only object-server.conf is used.
Object-expirer.conf is used only if all object-server.conf doesn't have
"object-expirer" section.

There are two differences between "object-expirer.conf" style and
"object-server.conf" style.

The first difference is `dequeue_from_legacy` default value.
`dequeue_from_legacy` defines task queue mode. In "object-expirer.conf"
style, the default mode is legacy queue. In "object-server.conf" style,
the default mode is general queue. But general mode means no-op mode
for now, because general task queue is not implemented yet.

The second difference is internal client config. In "object-expirer.conf"
style, config file of internal client is the object-expirer.conf itself.
In "object-server.conf" style, config file of internal client is
another file.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389/

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: Ib21568f9b9d8547da87a99d65ae73a550e9c3230

commit_message:
Unify auth_host/port/ssl/prefix func test options into auth_uri

Retain support for the old way, though (at least for now).

Change-Id: Id3c2ed87230c5918c18e2c01d086df8157f036b1

if needed), it works and compiles swift-rpc-losf.
But I removed the build/install distinction which we may want to keep?

Also, -Wl,-rpath does not appear to work yet, it would be nice for the
binary not to require setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH to find leveldb.so
It seems that the "go get levigo.." line compiles it but does not
install the binary, and the "go get" line eventually installs the
binary, but without the proper LDFLAGS. I don't know how to specify them
with the new go module system, I'll try again tomorrow

commit_message:
Add losf package installation for gate job

And also calling the setups as pre-run scripts.
To make it working well, this includes changes below:

Change the Makefile to work on vagrant swift all in one

With the $PATH properly set (needs $HOME/go/bin, and the path to cmake,
if needed), it works and compiles swift-rpc-losf.

Also, -Wl,-rpath does not appear to work yet, it would be nice for the
binary not to require setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH to find leveldb.so
It seems that the "go get levigo.." line compiles it but does not
install the binary.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandre Lécuyer <alexandre.lecuyer@corp.ovh.com>

Change-Id: Ief3287e650c80dea951d2c85b16d1eaa9b7631d5

messages:

(2 comments)

I think it's a good idea to use go modules, however I have not been able to make it work yet.
Here is where I am so far, beyond the notes inline, starting from
swiftstack's vagrant all in one (https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one):

I installed the protoc binary manually, because go get -u github.com/golang/protobuf/protoc-gen-go will only get protoc-gen-go

ran sudo make install leveldb, to get the include files installed in /usr/local/lib (where CGO_FLAGS expect them)

After that I get linker errors, but I think the problem is that leveldb .so files have not been installed/compiled, despite the BUILD_SHARED_LIBS being set to ON in the CMakeLists.txt.

I'll continue tomorrow!"}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2019-04-29 18:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2019-04-29 18:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2019-04-30 19:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2018-05-07 18:53:19.000000000', 'message': 'Unnessary deploying of bootstrap-osd ceph auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. heat does not need to pass this key to ceph::key as the
auth will already be populated on the monitors and the OSD nodes will
extract a copy from memory. This patch removes client.bootstrap-osd from
the ceph::profile::params::client_keys array.

Change-Id: Ia9c50afd3a88b27e6e0dca2ce150f91633681466
Partial-bug: 1769722
Depends-on: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
'}]
commit_message:
Unnessary deploying of bootstrap-osd ceph auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. heat does not need to pass this key to ceph::key as the
auth will already be populated on the monitors and the OSD nodes will
extract a copy from memory. This patch removes client.bootstrap-osd from
the ceph::profile::params::client_keys array.

Change-Id: Ia9c50afd3a88b27e6e0dca2ce150f91633681466
Partial-bug: 1769722
Depends-on: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
