(9 comments)

I think this is coming along nicely!  But I don't think this works yet.

First and foremost, let's drop out the auto upgrade fail_v1 shenanigans - that stuff is wasting our time for now. 
 I would much prefer an explicit config option "use_legacy_eventlet_object_server_api" which defaults to True for transparent upgrade, and then we can just turn it to false to test and in the lab - and later *after* we merge it - then we can decide if/how we need/want to take on automatic and/or cross-version rolling upgrades.

I managed to get the proxy to upload an encrypted EC object with PUT+POST+POST but I had to do... horrible... horrible things [1]

I'd like to see test-ecput split up a little bit so you can pause the script at various phases of the process and inspect the on-disk artifacts (i just inserted a bunch of

    raw_input('press enter to continue to XXX phase')

I always seemed to end up with a .data + .meta with this patch.  We want the EC/trailing metadata *on* the .datafile I'm pretty sure... I'm not sure if high-jacking the POST verb to do three different things is really ideal anymore.

If we want to use POST we should at least have the top-level method looking more like a router:

    def POST(req):
        if is_trailing_metadata(req):
            return self._update_datafile_with_metadata(req)
        elif is_final_commit_message(req):
            return self._do_commit(req)
        else:
            # regular object metadata POST
            return self._do_obj_post(req)

Trying to weave three wildly different things through a long winding series of if branches is an unmaintainable spaghetti disaster.

But I think in general this is very much on the right track!  Keep after it Pete!  Hope you survived your vacation thing... for some reason I imagine you jumping out of a plane!  :P

1. and then I &^%$ing lost it in an ill fated git stash pop :'(  I think I managed to get inline comments on all the bits I had to change tho!'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2017-10-17 01:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Couple things that I noticed while going through the code:
1. We would benefit greatly by documenting this new protocol somewhere, the challenge is that we don't really have design docs in git, so not sure how to go about that, but at the very least, we should definetely update this section: https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_erasure_code.html#under-the-hood
2. Got a feeling we need more tests. again I need to spend more time on our tests too.

follow'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-10 15:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(3 comments)

Oh, looks like I had some unpushed comments...'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-09-10 22:38:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Ok, I have this loaded back in my head.  We need to fix a few things.

First of all uploading to EC causes some HTTP protocol funkyness:

    Sep 10 21:17:50 saio object-6030: ERROR WSGI: code 400, message Bad request syntax ('0')

This does not seem to cause the client upload to fail - I think maybe POST is sending an empty chunked *body* (!?)

I'm super uncomfortable with how overloaded the POST api verb is on the object server.

In pseudo code I see two options:


    def PUT():
        initial_metadata = source.read_initial_metadata()
        fh = create(initial_metadata)
        for chunk in source:
            fh.write(chunk)
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        fh._commit()
        make_container_updates()
        return CREATED


    def POST():
        new_metadata = source.read_all_metadata()
        create_new_metafile(new_metadata)
        make_container_updates()
        return ACCEPTED


    def STAGE():
        initial_metadata = source.read_initial_metadata()
        fh = create(initial_metadata)
        for chunk in source:
            fh.write(chunk)
        temp_id = stash(fh)
        return ACCEPTED(temp_id)


    def UPDATE():
        fh = unstash(fh)
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        temp_id = stash(fh)
        return ACCEPTED(temp_id)


    def COMMIT():
        fh = unstash(fh)
        # N.B. only encrypted replicated will send final_metadata w/ COMMIT
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        fh._commit()
        make_container_updates()
        return CREATED


or if we're scared of VERBs

    def PUT():
        if x-commit:
            return _handle_put()
        else:
            return _handle_stage()

    def _handle_put():
        initial_metadata = source.read_initial_metadata()
        fh = create(initial_metadata)
        for chunk in source:
            fh.write(chunk)
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        fh._commit()
        make_container_updates()
        return CREATED


    def POST():
        if x-temp:
            if x-commit:
                return _handle_commit()
            else:
                return _handle_update()
        else:
            return _handle_post()

    def _handle_post()
        new_metadata = source.read_all_metadata()
        create_new_metafile(new_metadata)
        make_container_updates()
        return ACCEPTED


    def _handle_stage():
        initial_metadata = source.read_initial_metadata()
        fh = create(initial_metadata)
        for chunk in source:
            fh.write(chunk)
        temp_id = stash(fh)
        return ACCEPTED(temp_id)


    def _handle_update():
        fh = unstash(fh)
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        temp_id = stash(fh)
        return ACCEPTED(temp_id)


    def _handle_commit():
        fh = unstash(fh)
        # N.B. only encrypted replicated will send final_metadata w/ COMMIT
        final_metadata = source.read_final_metadata()
        fh._store_metadata(final_metadata)
        fh._commit()
        make_container_updates()
        return CREATED"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-09-10 22:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

I have a pretty good idea of how I want to move forward with the DiskFile stuff, and I'm going to try to move to new STAGE-UPDATE-COMMIT verbs in the obj-server.

I *think* like the DoulbePutter stuff in the proxy...

I'll probably put up some code before I review this again."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-09-11 21:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

But! fixes the weird error message about "0". This is the 3-phase version (PUT+POST+POST).

- Using conn.path

- Cleaned up useless *kw in make_on_disk_filename()

- Patched node_timeout through DoublePutter() - unlike conn.path
- Made sure "v2" returns 400 (future-proof) - a review comment by acoles
- Made the final_phase depend on the underlying putter
- Introduced frag_prefs, or else POST cannot open non-durable and 404
- Preserved our meta from being filtered out

- Introduced frag_prefs, or else POST cannot open non-durable and 404
- Preserved our meta from being filtered out
- Removed the timer-based fallback, added the use_put_v1 knob
- re-factored object POST to reduce technical debt w/ _post_metadata()
- let DoublePutter to pipe chunked, pushed treatment of length into putter
- stored the metadata in the .data like PUT, not .meta as a normal POST
- Allow successes as well as informational responses from putters

TODO:

- Incorporate torgomatic's patch that allows us to return to linkat()
- Add more unit tests - acoles volunteered to help with the framework issues
- Ensure a cleanup of tmp*/ that does not sweep fresh temporary files
- Catch newly-added ChunkWriteTimeout in proxy
- [Decide if the loss of transient sysmeta is bad, see the unit test]
- Find why proxy adds "Connection: Close"

Change-Id: I64b0d8fdb2ffce786f56665a74ed7eb2603abfda

commit_message:
Replace MIME with PUT+POST for EC and Encryption

Actually, we do not force a replacement outright, for compatibility
and safety reasons. Instead, a configuration option is provided to
enable the new protocol.

This is the 3-phase version (PUT+POST+POST) with a persisting DiskFile.

The Id7619a7ea356be33d3e5b3ad70d6880608320740 is not used anymore.
Instead, we rely of DiskFileWriter.open().

Co-authored-by: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I64b0d8fdb2ffce786f56665a74ed7eb2603abfda

subject: [www] Avoid duplicate API-guide
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-01 18:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-03 18:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-03 22:38:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nlgtm, thx'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-01 18:28:02.000000000', 'message': '[www] Avoid duplicate API-guide

Barbican has an in-tree API reference and an api-guide on developer.o.o.
Both show up on the index page as "API Guide". Rename the in-tree
document to "API Documentation" to differentiate it from the others in
case teams have both in-tree and out-of-tree docs.

Change-Id: I80b51cea1898a7cf5c3f254d42b7a86d0c67e2b0
'}]
commit_message:
[www] Avoid duplicate API-guide

Barbican has an in-tree API reference and an api-guide on developer.o.o.
Both show up on the index page as "API Guide". Rename the in-tree
document to "API Documentation" to differentiate it from the others in
case teams have both in-tree and out-of-tree docs.

Change-Id: I80b51cea1898a7cf5c3f254d42b7a86d0c67e2b0

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ie7bcc327fd588a1ff6b2556d49017df56bc55bf8

subject: Cap flake8 version
messages: [{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-05-03 20:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 14:40:55.000000000', 'message': 'Cap flake8 version

flake8 is generally not capped in upper constraints,
and somewhere since 3.6.x it started to report a spurious error
in cliff/app.py:409.

Cap flake8 to <3.6 to unblock the pep8 CI.

Change-Id: I0b12103e581a5c95f69da2cebf3310101150bd3b
'}]
commit_message:
Cap flake8 version

flake8 is generally not capped in upper constraints,
and somewhere since 3.6.x it started to report a spurious error
in cliff/app.py:409.

Cap flake8 to <3.6 to unblock the pep8 CI.

Change-Id: I0b12103e581a5c95f69da2cebf3310101150bd3b

commit_message:
Remove n-obj from zuul and docs

n-obj hasn't been around for many years and devstack
doesn't use it anymore anyway so this just cleans up
some vestigial use of the old service.

[{'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-18 19:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-18 20:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-19 04:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-22 00:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-22 13:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Erik - So... why did this work?'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-22 16:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> @Erik - So... why did this work?

.... because the ironic client ha does the endpoint lookup?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-22 16:21:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Oh, right.

So to actually prove this bug, we would need something like multiple regions, and show a case where the ironicclient picks an endpoint in a region *other* than the one specified in the conf.

I'm not real savvy on devstack; how hard would it be to set that up? (And is it something we could make permanent?)"}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-23 03:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Oh, right.
 > 
 > So to actually prove this bug, we would need something like
 > multiple regions, and show a case where the ironicclient picks an
 > endpoint in a region *other* than the one specified in the conf.
 > 
 > I'm not real savvy on devstack; how hard would it be to set that
 > up? (And is it something we could make permanent?)

Yea - that would be ideal, but short term this will at least make sure that the code path acts the same way when a region is provided.

Testing multi regions gets a bit tricky, as even if you have two regions, it's still possible that it will pick the "right" region. Since there is no "default" region, so the result is random(ish).

In an ideal scenario we would have a test with two regions, and attempt to connect to both regions (to make sure we are not just "accidentally" connecting to the expected region).'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

lgtm, and for other reviewers it's related to this change:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654692/

If you respin, I'd add a "Related-Bug: #1825583" to the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

http://logs.openstack.org/36/653836/3/check/ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa/03e9390/controller/logs/etc/nova/nova-cpu_conf.txt.gz

api_retry_interval = 5
api_max_retries = 300
region_name = RegionOne
project_name = demo
user_domain_id = default
project_domain_id = default
auth_url = https://10.4.70.43/identity
password = secretadmin
username = admin
auth_type = password'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1825583'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-29 10:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2019-05-03 19:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add region_name to ironic compute configuration

We should always pass on a region when talking to
ironic. This will also help detect and test issues
specific to regions.

Change-Id: Iaab3c1bcedc5aaa2106c0758cbb43bade3de2cf5

commit_message:
Add ids to sections of flavors guide to allow deep-linking

The flavors section of the user guide is comprehensive with many
sub-sections, but only some of them had anchor ids.  Add anchors for
the rest so that deep-linking to any of these sub-sections is
possible.

Change-Id: I84984d7534c9c92b51fb4e1797cf6a9db3c28755

working on instances with SR-IOV interfaces.

Change-Id: I8ef852d449e9e637d45e4ac92ffc5d1abd8d31c5
Closes-Bug: #1821798
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 20:57:13.000000000', 'message': 'nova diagnostics command is not working with all interfaces

get_instance_diagnostics expected all interfaces
to have a <target> element with a "dev" attribute in
the instance XML. This is not the case for VFIO
interfaces (<interface type="hostdev">).
This caused an IndexError when looping over
the interfaces.

This patch fixes this issue by retrieving interfaces
data directly from the guest XML and adding nics
appropriately to the diagnostics object.

Change-Id: I8ef852d449e9e637d45e4ac92ffc5d1abd8d31c5
Closes-Bug: #1821798
'}, {'created': '2019-04-15 15:16:44.000000000', 'message': 'Include all network devices in nova diagnostics

get_instance_diagnostics expected all interfaces
to have a <target> element with a "dev" attribute in
the instance XML. This is not the case for VFIO
interfaces (<interface type="hostdev">).
This caused an IndexError when looping over
the interfaces.

This patch fixes this issue by retrieving interfaces
data directly from the guest XML and adding nics
appropriately to the diagnostics object.

Change-Id: I8ef852d449e9e637d45e4ac92ffc5d1abd8d31c5
Closes-Bug: #1821798
'}]
commit_message:
Include all network devices in nova diagnostics

get_instance_diagnostics expected all interfaces
to have a <target> element with a "dev" attribute in
the instance XML. This is not the case for VFIO
interfaces (<interface type="hostdev">).
This caused an IndexError when looping over
the interfaces.

This patch fixes this issue by retrieving interfaces
data directly from the guest XML and adding nics
appropriately to the diagnostics object.

Change-Id: I8ef852d449e9e637d45e4ac92ffc5d1abd8d31c5
Closes-Bug: #1821798

commit_message:
WIP: Prevent host value change in containerized overcloud.

This is a follow up from pike on where container get a fresh
configuration each time, so we can't use os_immutable there.

This part allow the puppet run to get the current value from fact
passed on the command line.

It's only a POC and a support for discussion at this time, as an
alternative to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562876/ .

Change-Id: I53c11eb8d3a3dad4e551b0bb5fae43e79c343ba0

commit_message:
WIP: Mount /etc/puppet/ssl rw

WIP: Still need to check that mounting the same ssl dir for all
container is ok.  Would feel better if it was unique for each one.

This directory is check for ownership by puppet apply.  This is
mounted ro from /etc/puppet.  If the puppet' host uid/gid has been
changed by the sysadmin, then puppet fails.

This makes /etc/puppet/ssl rw.  The certificates here are not used by
puppet apply and are not a security issue.

Change-Id: I78dcd9bcd213aa1ad074a5c8b94ff18322b72f5b
Closes-Bug: #1808844

commit_message:
Set debug level of nova container_config_scripts only when enabled

Right now all scripts log in DEBUG level. This change enables only
DEBUG level if debug is also enabled for the nova service.

Change-Id: Ie58a6630877a58bec8ce763ede166997bd41f882
(cherry picked from commit 4d4263f4f1f1e49851503162fcd8d3cfca163b73)

commit_message:
Fix cinder-backup deployment templates

Fix the step_config portion of the puppet_config that configures the
cinder-backup service's backend driver. For the pacemaker version,
fix the path to the CinderBackupBase's step_config.

Closes-Bug: #1826897

messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-29 13:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:06:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I have mixed feelings about this.

In the meantime query within and the following:

Also, yeah, the 404 would be a microversion, by the rules.

My primary concern here, however, is managing the case where there may exist a consumer uuid which at time A doesn't yet exist. It makes some allocations, goes on its business, and then deletes those allocations. Now at time B, for whatever reason, that same uuid (that is, the same consumer) wants to allocate again. If it tries to just PUT with null generation, it will conflict, so it will need to GET, parse generation and then PUT again.

This means that a generic client may as well always GET /allocations/{uuid} before doing a PUT but has to branch between getting a 404 or getting a response to determine the generation it wants to send.

That feels cumbersome, and a bit weird. And is also a really long way from earlier models of how allocations were going to happen: rapid fire and very simple, potentially with consumer identifiers that weren't even uuids. We have moved on since then, but that change has implications we need to understand."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20927 : FAILURE in 57m 53s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:56:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I believe Chris's concerns - both the race potential and the need for awkward branching by the caller - go away if we auto-delete consumers with allocations.

GET /allocations/{nonexistent} should still 404, because otherwise what proj/user would we put in there?  (The defaults don't really make sense.)  But with auto-delete, if you're doing a GET, it's because you expect something to be there, and 404 is an actual error, which is fine."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-29 15:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-01 16:48:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For reference, there was extensive discussion in IRC related to this:

from: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2018-06-29.log.html#t2018-06-29T13:49:51
to: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2018-06-29.log.html#t2018-06-29T14:58:13

We didn't reach full agreement but did agree to talk about it more here."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-07-03 19:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I believe Chris's concerns - both the race potential and the need
 > for awkward branching by the caller - go away if we auto-delete
 > consumers with allocations.
 > 
 > GET /allocations/{nonexistent} should still 404, because otherwise
 > what proj/user would we put in there?  (The defaults don't really
 > make sense.)  But with auto-delete, if you're doing a GET, it's
 > because you expect something to be there, and 404 is an actual
 > error, which is fine.

Yeah, I agree with this. I find it super weird that we don't 404 currently. What to do if we have, delete, then have a consumer again is a little weird, but auto-delete is the only thing that I think makes sense. If we don't, then honestly we should expose a create and delete on consumer, which would be uncool I think.

Without either, and always returning empty allocations for non-existent consumers, I think we're bumping into the old nova quota behavior, where you can set quota limits for any identifier you claim is a project. We can't tell you if the project you want to set quota for is real, or deleted, or garbage. You say "set quota=10 for project foo" and we damn well do it, even if nothing will ever see that quota ever. This "meh, could be a consumer with no allocations" behavior seems similarly unhelpful.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-03 21:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll throw my vote in that we should auto-delete consumer information, which at the moment is internal metadata, when the allocations are deleted, which are externally managed through the REST API. I consider this like instance system_metadata which is deleted when the top-level resource (the instance record) is deleted. I don't really want to see a full CRUD set of APIs for consumer records in placement until we actually need something like that (consumer types maybe?)."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-03 22:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

#agreed in IRC [1] to auto-delete consumers when their last allocation goes away.

Which implies a kind of heal thingy that should delete an allocation-less consumer if you try to GET it.

Which would mean we should never GET an allocation-less payload.  And it makes sense to 404 if you ask for allocs against a nonexistent consumer.

Also #agreed to combine auto-deletion of consumers and all of its tendrils into a single microversion, which would include this patch.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2018-07-03.log.html#t2018-07-03T21:42:32'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:07:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

we're now deleting consumers that have no allocations"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:13:15.000000000', 'content': "Restored

We shouldn't abandon this.  It still makes sense to error 404 if I GET /allocations/{nonexistent}."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Restored
 > 
 > We shouldn't abandon this.  It still makes sense to error 404 if I
 > GET /allocations/{nonexistent}.

Pretty sure it would be 400, not 404, but I can un-abandon if we decide to go that route (and we'd need a new microversion if we did)."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm still of the opinion that it would be 404 rather than 400 because the missing thing is in the URI, not in the body.

Regardless, I believe the current behavior

  status: 200
  {
      "allocations": {}
  }

is wrong because the response payload doesn't conform to the expected format, which would contain a consumer_generation, project_id, and user_id.  That those fields don't make sense in a context where there's no consumer is another motivator for making this a 4xx failure.

Do we need a new microversion for that?  Probably, which is ugh.  But so be it.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 23:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Updated commit message with bug, added commentary to that bug.  Regardless, this patch isn't ready to go as is (if for no better reason than the DO NOT MERGE in the commit message)."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-10 07:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/579163/2/ : FAILURE in 5h 34m 20s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

yeah, should be 404, I added additional thoughts on the bug, and some recent api-sig discussion'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2018-07-11 15:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2018-07-11 15:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by XiaojueGuan <guanalbertjone@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm abandoning this because placement code is being deleted from nova and the nova bug is marked wontfix. If the issue still exists in placement, there'll be a story for it, and the fix should be proposed there."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

we decided this wasn't going to be needed"}]

commit_message:
return 404 when no consumer found in allocs

DO NOT MERGE

Modifies the GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid} endpoint to have the same
behaviour as GET /resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/allocations when there is
no consumer found matching {consumer_uuid}: return a 404 Not Found
instead of a response with an empty allocations dict.

Related, we also now return the consumer generation, project external ID
and user external ID for consumers that have no allocations. This is a
change in the behaviour of the GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}
endpoint, but I'm not sure whether it warrants a new microversion.
Definitely open to advice on that point.

Marked DO NOT MERGE because the gabbitlets added to the allocations.yaml
gabbit seem to be exposing a latent bug. The user and project external
IDs being returned are the default values of
CONF.placement.incomplete_project_external_id and
CONF.placement.incomplete_user_external_id instead of the
$ENVIRON['project_id'] and $ENVIRON['user_id'] values that are supplied
in the PUT /allocations/{consumer_uuid} call. I'm still trying to
determine why this is happening.

Closes-Bug: #1778591

Change-Id: I6709d068f109f25b25843b70aa77078ece8941ab

commit_message:
Reset global variable after unit test is completed.

resource_provider._RC_CACHE is a global variable, and after
each unit test is completed, the value before the test
should be restored without affecting subsequent unit
test results.

Change-Id: I8e1d068e0366b3d9fbde9da9c10deb97069d96aa

commit_message:
Don't use node count from failed stack parameters

While checking node count in predeploy validations, if the stack
is in FAILED state, parameters may not represent the actual nodes
in stack. Don't use them for validations.

Change-Id: I12213909a47e0a186bdb2e06c58784457bfe8d13
Closes-Bug: #1826925

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-06-09 11:23:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sylvain, while you make some valid points about how pep3333 expects configuration to be passed into the application, the missing piece here is that the environment variable is only allowing _one_ directory for the config file and the command line args are allow oslo_config to look in at least two places.

I'm not sure what the best solution is, but there is a real problem here that needs a solution."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-06-09 12:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

As Chris mentioned, in our use-case we start the nova-placement-api with a nova.conf that may exist in one of two different directories, and this fix gives us the ability to use multiple --config-file locations.

Also worth noting, keystone already supports this, although in a different code location. keystone calls CONF() without specifying the args parameter which results in oslo.config using sys.argv[1:]. https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/server/common.py#L33'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2017-06-09 13:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Not sure I understand why you need multiple directories for the configuration ?
Maybe we could be discussing then about adding new environment variables for that, then ?'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-06-09 14:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

With snap packaging (see snapcraft.io) the package is installed into a read-only squashfs filesystem, which includes a default nova.conf. To override the defaults, you can specify a nova.conf in a different writable directory that is specific to the snap, or use conf.d/ snippets from that writable directory.  In addition to --config-file, --config-dir is another CLI option that we use as well as --log-file.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-07-05 08:56:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks.

Another option probably can be specifying multiple dirs in OS_PLACEMENT_CONFIG_DIRS and make kind of inheritance for configs,
but taking into account that keystone already uses same approach and it's easy to implement, so +1 and recheck."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-03 21:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Placement is deleted from nova. If this is still needed, please propose it to openstack/placement.'}]

commit_message:
Pass CLI options to nova-placement-api

This enables execution of nova-placement-api if nova.conf
doesn't exist in the typical location of /etc/nova/nova.conf
and OS_PLACEMENT_CONFIG_DIR is not set. In our case with the
OpenStack snap for nova, we have two possible paths we may
pick nova.conf up from, based on what --config-file specifies.
The --config-file and --config-dir CLI options get parsed in
oslo.config (in the __call__() method of the ConfigOpts class).

Change-Id: Ia0c6563e8583b3078aea5cc5fa3efc4f1afa43e2
Closes-Bug: 1696830

commit_message:
Return anchor providers in a_r and p_s

Anchor providers (those not providing any resource themselves, but
serving as anchor points for sharing providers which do) now show up in
the response payload of GET /allocation_candidates. In the
allocation_request, they show up with an empty "resources" dict.  In the
provider_summaries (where they were previously absent unless they
provided resource for some other allocation_request) they now appear
with their usage information as expected.

Change-Id: If4aed262c3a51ea2621c41db6649c9332619c378

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 20:22:50.000000000', 'message': 'add root parent NULL online migration

When we added parent and root_provider_id to the resource_providers
table, we made both fields NULLable. root_provider_id should not be
NULLable, however. Resource providers that have NULL root_provider_id
values simply represent compute node providers and therefore should have
their root_provider_id set to the value of the id column.

Change-Id: I27fce471e559543aeaccc73052820c2cea48f266
'}]
commit_message:
add root parent NULL online migration

When we added parent and root_provider_id to the resource_providers
table, we made both fields NULLable. root_provider_id should not be
NULLable, however. Resource providers that have NULL root_provider_id
values simply represent compute node providers and therefore should have
their root_provider_id set to the value of the id column.

Change-Id: I27fce471e559543aeaccc73052820c2cea48f266

[{'created': '2019-04-23 07:50:41.000000000', 'message': "Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

Closes-Bug: #1822778

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a
(cherry picked from commit 4d2787227b00b973973554f7387e621d2664c0d8)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

Closes-Bug: #1822778

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a
(cherry picked from commit 4d2787227b00b973973554f7387e621d2664c0d8)

commit_message:
Adds secrets_retrieve to the list of available actions in barbican

This method allows to retrieve the payloads of secrets in the
workflows.

Change-Id: I7d391a6b46ddd4b388c11a69b75f2a2cd7e40384
Closes-Bug: #1800821

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 17:54:03.000000000', 'message': "py3: Be able to parse non-RFC-compliant request lines

There's a bug in CPython [1] that causes servers to mis-parse request
lines that include the bytes \x85 or \xa0.  Naturally, we have
functional tests that (with high probability) will send such request
lines. There's a fix proposed, but the earliest it's likely to land
would be for 3.8, and we need to be able to target an earlier Python.

So, intercept the request line immediately before parsing and re-write
it to be RFC-compliant. Note that this is done for Python 2 as well,
though there should be no change in the request environment that
eventlet eventually hands to us.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue33973

Change-Id: Ie648f5c04d4415f3b620fb196fa567ce7575d522

commit_message:
py3: Be able to parse non-RFC-compliant request lines

There's a bug in CPython [1] that causes servers to mis-parse request
lines that include the bytes \x85 or \xa0.  Naturally, we have
functional tests that (with high probability) will send such request
lines. There's a fix proposed, but the earliest it's likely to land
would be for 3.8, and we need to be able to target an earlier Python.

So, intercept the request line immediately before parsing and re-write
it to be RFC-compliant. Note that this is done for Python 2 as well,
though there should be no change in the request environment that
eventlet eventually hands to us.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue33973

Change-Id: Ie648f5c04d4415f3b620fb196fa567ce7575d522

subject: Make log format for requests configurable

messages:
[{'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-03-01 13:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-01 13:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-02 01:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I generally like it; seems useful for GDPR, yeah? Might be nice to document it in etc/proxy-server.conf-sample too.

Are we going to need similar changes to the various storage servers? Say around https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.17.0/swift/obj/server.py#L1162-L1168

Or is the plan to just turn off log_requests on the storage servers?'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-03-05 10:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-03-05 10:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Hi,

Yes, it could be ;)

For now, I only change the access-logs part which is easy because the log building is already well split. For the others parts (rest of proxy, object servers, ...) it will be more complex, but I think it can be useful for operators to be able to customize all logs for a better integration with log management tools.

Adding the log-name in the log message didn't change the final log. In fact, the log-name is added here by default ('server' variable): https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/utils.py#L1873. In this change, we override the fmt parameter with "%(message)s" only, and the 'server' variable (the log-name), is added in the log building.

I forgot to edit etc/proxy-server.conf-sample and the doc/source/logs.rst, it's done.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-03-07 17:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I love the work here.

I'm concerned about adding a new field to the beginning of the line. Doing so will break existing log parsers, right? Can we add the field to the end of the line instead? That will allow well-written log parsers to still work after the cluster is upgraded."}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-03-08 11:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-03-08 14:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Tim and John,

I understand your concerns about the "{log_name}: " that I added in the message part of logs.
I removed this part in the Patch Set 3 I just pushed. Now, it doesn't change the default log format.

There are 2 things I want to do:
I want to be able to customize logs (I want to write a template in config to have my logs in a LTSV format).
I want to have anonymized logs.

The reason why I added the "{log_name}: " is because there is a point that annoys me for the LTSV formatting:
The default format (fmt) in the get_logger() in common/utils.py is: "%(server)s: %(message)s". There is a space character after the ':'. In Syslog, the message part of the log is everything after this ':' including this space. So, in my actual log management process, I have to remove it to get exactly the same part of the message (equivalent to the %(message)).

Maybe is it worth to work on the templating of the message in a first change, and then we will think about the format of logs in a second patch. It could be the opportunity to review the format for all servers and not only the access-logs part of the proxy server.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-05-30 21:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Looks good, some small things to fix.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-06-12 13:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-06-12 13:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Uploaded patch set 5.

Hi Romain.

In this change, I fixed what you said. I changed the config variable name for the templating of logs to "log_msg_template".

I also added the variable "log_anonymization_salt" which is a salt for md5 hashs of anonymized information.

Thanks for your advices.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-14 22:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Uploaded patch set 6.

Hi Tim,

It is true that the management of 'keywords' in replacement was weird.
I changed many things in this patch set :)

Now, I use the possibility of the formater to call properties during formatting. In the log_msg_template it is possible to write {object} or {object.anonymized} (second one is the hash). For timestamps it is possible to get a date with {end_time.datetime} or to build date with {end_time.H} (using strftime directives).

And, if the configuration is wrong, an error will be raised during the initialization and not later :)

Thanks for your comments,"}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-06-18 15:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-08-20 16:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-09-07 07:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-09-07 10:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-09-07 12:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-07 17:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Published edit on patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2018-09-10 16:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Make log format for requests configurable

Add the log_msg_template option in proxy-server.conf and log_format in
a/c/o-server.conf. It is a string parsable by Python's format()
function. Some fields containing user data might be anonymized by using
log_anonymization_method and log_anonymization_salt.

Change-Id: I29e30ef45fe3f8a026e7897127ffae08a6a80cd9

commit_message:
libvirt: Stop ignoring unknown libvirtError exceptions during volume attach

Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a attempted to introduce a
simple breadcrumb in the logs to highlight a known Libvirt issue.
Unfortunately this change resulted in libvirtError exceptions that
didn't match the known issue being silently ignored.

This change corrects this by using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception
to ensure all libvirtError exceptions are logged and raised regardless
of being linked to the known issue.

Change-Id: Ib440f4f2e484312af5f393722363846f6c95b760
Closes-Bug: #1825882

commit_message:
libvirt: remove conditional on VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY

As the comment being removed says, libvirt >= 1.3.3 will provide
the VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY and
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_MIGRATED enums and since we require
3.0.0 since Stein [1] we can drop the hasattr checks.

[1] I408baef12358a83921c4693b847a692f6c19e36f

commit_message:
libvirt: drop MIN_LIBVIRT_POSTCOPY_VERSION

Change I408baef12358a83921c4693b847a692f6c19e36f in Stein
bumped the minimum required version of libvirt to 3.0.0
so we can drop the minimum version check for post-copy
support along with the related unit tests.

While in here, this fixes a typo in the help text for the
live_migration_permit_post_copy config option.

Change-Id: Id55fbb44eec67cba18293deb25ba4d54fbfd83bc

commit_message:
Fix help for ironic.peer_list config

This implied that the current host did not need to be in this list;
however, it does.

Closes-Bug: #1827094
Change-Id: I4fe9df6b3789ae0365900d546d49121b99ea2a44
(cherry picked from commit 674c004231a3f7696962d7a7bfa69b4b31af4de8)

commit_message:
Update Brocade FCZM driver's driver options

This patch updates the get_driver_options to include
the missing brocade fczm options for documentation.

Change-Id: I78877d210b350d6132009397c0a7f27dc0f8cf54

[{'created': '2019-04-30 01:39:50.000000000', 'message': "Not process port forwarding if no snat functionality

If dvr router is processed on a 'dvr_snat' node but without snat
functionality, the port forwarding should not be processed on
this host since the snat-namespace will never be created. For
instance, the isolated DHCP node which only have the namespace
of qrouter. The l3 agent will process this router, but should
not do any port forwarding actions.

Change-Id: I6ecd86089643f4eb98865a8d8d0dec4359564026
Closes-Bug: #1825088
(cherry picked from commit 4082e280c8574708ec644f9eaa1cdb4a2169141c)
"}]
commit_message:
Not process port forwarding if no snat functionality

If dvr router is processed on a 'dvr_snat' node but without snat
functionality, the port forwarding should not be processed on
this host since the snat-namespace will never be created. For
instance, the isolated DHCP node which only have the namespace
of qrouter. The l3 agent will process this router, but should
not do any port forwarding actions.

Change-Id: I6ecd86089643f4eb98865a8d8d0dec4359564026
Closes-Bug: #1825088
(cherry picked from commit 4082e280c8574708ec644f9eaa1cdb4a2169141c)

[{'created': '2019-04-30 01:39:38.000000000', 'message': "Not process port forwarding if no snat functionality

If dvr router is processed on a 'dvr_snat' node but without snat
functionality, the port forwarding should not be processed on
this host since the snat-namespace will never be created. For
instance, the isolated DHCP node which only have the namespace
of qrouter. The l3 agent will process this router, but should
not do any port forwarding actions.

Change-Id: I6ecd86089643f4eb98865a8d8d0dec4359564026
Closes-Bug: #1825088
(cherry picked from commit 4082e280c8574708ec644f9eaa1cdb4a2169141c)
"}]
commit_message:
Not process port forwarding if no snat functionality

If dvr router is processed on a 'dvr_snat' node but without snat
functionality, the port forwarding should not be processed on
this host since the snat-namespace will never be created. For
instance, the isolated DHCP node which only have the namespace
of qrouter. The l3 agent will process this router, but should
not do any port forwarding actions.

Change-Id: I6ecd86089643f4eb98865a8d8d0dec4359564026
Closes-Bug: #1825088
(cherry picked from commit 4082e280c8574708ec644f9eaa1cdb4a2169141c)

messages: [{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-03 16:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-05-03 18:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-25 09:53:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)

commit_message:
Add TRAIN to deprecated releases

Keystone uses versionutils for marking config settings
as deprecated and currently TRAIN is missing as an option.

This change adds the same.

Change-Id: I0307665d468ac90b5208aadf6f85373bc339b44d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-01 22:00:32.000000000', 'message': 'Document that server dump create requires 2.17

There is no indication to the user in the command
help that they have to use 2.17 or greater [1] to run
the "openstack server dump create" command. This
mentions that requirement in the help of the command.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#trigger-crash-dump-in-server

Change-Id: I02c06e10a26eb38ddecb70f970cfcbfad962201c
'}]
commit_message:
Document that server dump create requires 2.17

There is no indication to the user in the command
help that they have to use 2.17 or greater [1] to run
the "openstack server dump create" command. This
mentions that requirement in the help of the command.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#trigger-crash-dump-in-server

Change-Id: I02c06e10a26eb38ddecb70f970cfcbfad962201c

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I739cd53efa4f685d721dc4c9095d5df273b2acae

commit_message:
Create/delete network policy in non-default namespace

Create network policy on non-default namespace and make sure that
CRD and SG were created for that policy
Remove network policy in non-default namespace and make sure
the network policy CRD and SG were deleted

Change-Id: I8a0a4b3a8ef18072eef0db05eb98eb1f7ca57553

commit_message:
[WIP] Ceph-RGW chart cleanup.

- With this ps, rgw can now be
configured/deployed based on following
conf:
  rgw_ks:
    enabled: false
  rgw_s3:
    enabled: true
One of these should be false and other as true.

Change-Id: I9932c15b36ec76ae3ce95ffcbb02b51e2a81b724

commit_message:
WIP-Loopback device setup/configuration

- Setup loopback devices using Ansible
- Ensure devices are available after reboot

Author:   renis makadia <renis.makadia@att.com>

Change-Id: I5f462ecc4e73c7a5176f9f8c4b5718ac79af1e12

commit_message:
WIP - Mergeing disk and device manifests

This PS track changes to merge Device and Disk Manifests.

Following things have changed per this PS
- We are not labeling nodes for Directory in a similar way
as Device for consistency
- Directory storage will be enabled by default
- ceph/templates/daemonset-osd.yaml is not now combine version for both
Device and Directory storage.
- In order to use Directory option, you must also update
CEPH_OSD_DIRECTORY_DEFAULT_LABELS in vars.sh with Directory name (from
values.yaml)

Change-Id: I95b11099ae6a4328c02eb1bdd882ac1df8c7b5a9

'}, {'created': '2017-09-21 22:09:50.000000000', 'message': 'This PS adds a way to convert host based bus IDs of attached devices to logical disks.

subject: Port puppet-cinder-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-02 09:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'Port puppet-cinder-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest

Previously Tripleo validate-tempest role was used to run tempest
on tripleo jobs. Recently we are moving to os_tempest (an unified
role developed by openstack-ansible team).

It moves the vars to os_tempest.
Below is the other var changes:
run_tempest: false -> to disable validate-tempest role
use_os_tempest: true -> enable os_tempest
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist
tempest_plugins -> tempest_services now just the name of the service,
not the plugin package name

Change-Id: I4dd4f82d545cdfb4de48d6d37ee0f28f3e8c6d00
'}]
commit_message:
Port puppet-cinder-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest

Previously Tripleo validate-tempest role was used to run tempest
on tripleo jobs. Recently we are moving to os_tempest (an unified
role developed by openstack-ansible team).

It moves the vars to os_tempest.
Below is the other var changes:
run_tempest: false -> to disable validate-tempest role
use_os_tempest: true -> enable os_tempest
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist
tempest_plugins -> tempest_services now just the name of the service,
not the plugin package name

Change-Id: I4dd4f82d545cdfb4de48d6d37ee0f28f3e8c6d00

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ic98870c5449203556034eedd3a997afc3679efaf

commit_message:
Have language_version as a member of StorletRequest

StorletRequest is used to parse basic options for storlet
excecutions. This patch makes language_version also a mamber
of the class, which is currently handled outside it.

Change-Id: Id887fb0eaab528005a946013f9faf6ddca82bf42

commit_message:
Port puppet-horizon-tripleo-standalone to os_tempest

Previously Tripleo validate-tempest role was used to run tempest
on tripleo jobs. Recently we are moving to os_tempest (an unified

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-05-02 18:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-05-02 18:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-05-03 15:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-02 18:26:31.000000000', 'message': 'Do not log tracebacks for expected exceptions

The tripleoclient exceptions are supposed to have enough context,
logging their traceback just confuses the users. Note that with
--debug all exceptions will have a traceback anyway.

This change introduces a base class for tripleoclient exceptions.

Change-Id: Iffc7b557ebd7e30ff56ceaee702ed3c4466d4eea
Closes-Bug: #1824329
(cherry picked from commit b3cef86bb9783eb3b68ca918221ee9eb46232121)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log tracebacks for expected exceptions

The tripleoclient exceptions are supposed to have enough context,
logging their traceback just confuses the users. Note that with
--debug all exceptions will have a traceback anyway.

This change introduces a base class for tripleoclient exceptions.

Change-Id: Iffc7b557ebd7e30ff56ceaee702ed3c4466d4eea
Closes-Bug: #1824329
(cherry picked from commit b3cef86bb9783eb3b68ca918221ee9eb46232121)

commit_message:
Fixed doc building steps for collect logs

Ensure required python packages are installed task in collect-logs
looks for doc-requirements.txt for building docs but it is not
there which is leading to failure.

Including docs under the roles fixes the issue.
It also moves doc-requirments.txt under docs folder and fix the
installation path

Change-Id: Ica076ab17ef96d8cf53d321544def97fbb0bfc48
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure maxdelay in db purge/archive job

This patch introduces new parameters, CinderCronDbPurgeMaxDelay
and NovaCronDBArchivedMaxDelay, which enable us to configure
maxdelay parameter in cinder db purge cron job and nova db archive
cron job, like HeatCronPurgeDeletedMaxDelay which is used to
configure maxdelay in heat cron job.

Conflicts:
    deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1823274
Change-Id: I112a228ed90a50aeee787e83a58a014519db7992
(cherry picked from commit 2a34ccb62b1037c420bff6e5f9d19f8887cf774a)
(cherry picked from commit 3a4a77356fe372fbbd70d8902af65067646ad81b)
(cherry picked from commit 733ec337c3d376267ad5bf80c3826ca4517ac7ca)

commit_message:
Adjust deployed-server install package list for RHEL8

 - python-ipaddress is not available in rhel8
 - python3-heat-agent* need to be installed instead of
   python-heat-agent*
 - lvm2 is required by ceph deployments

Closes-bug: 1827276

Change-Id: Id5eb7edb48a7c56e8c9a3798fc8bd3eb08f4294a
(cherry picked from commit d9c83dbf9bdd383f1496cc9b14db3ae27e776938)

commit_message:
Check compute_node existence in when nova-compute reports info to placement

If deleting service when nova-compute service is active, nova-compute will
continue to report the old resource_provider uuid, this will raise
ResourceProviderCreationFailed.
So add _get_compute_node in _update_to_placement to ensure compute_node existence.

Change-Id: I3230897de2414f1f210edc7194f890c45decd565
Closes-Bug: #1817833

[{'created': '2019-05-02 17:06:36.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set default_flow_style to False

In PyYAML 5.1 they changed this default in the library. Because
we weren't explicitly setting it, this broke our unit tests.
Since default_flow_style=False is usually what you want (hence why
PyYAML changed it), let's set it explicitly.

Also note that this was already being set for dump, but not for
dumps. This is also more consistent.

Change-Id: I3f7dfce5ceb5d3b802878c410406994cbb0988b6
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set default_flow_style to False

In PyYAML 5.1 they changed this default in the library. Because
we weren't explicitly setting it, this broke our unit tests.
Since default_flow_style=False is usually what you want (hence why
PyYAML changed it), let's set it explicitly.

Also note that this was already being set for dump, but not for
dumps. This is also more consistent.

Change-Id: I3f7dfce5ceb5d3b802878c410406994cbb0988b6

commit_message:
Docs improvements: task timeout, global context, Docker and jinja

A not obvious point for users is the task does not retry after a
timeout is triggered. Added clarification in the retry section.

The documentation contains enough example with Jinja usage. Improved
only the create_vm workflow definition.

Added global publishing to the doc. It is brash copy-paste from
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/mistral-specs/specs/pike/approved/advanced_publishing.html without mention of atomic publish.

Move Docker guides to the installation section.

Change-Id: I149b2e1dff7f86bd356f4dd2f758659469e6a4a8
Closes-Bug: #1789384
Closes-Bug: #1690156
Closes-Bug: #1779244
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:

commit_message:
Reference OpenStack logo in openstackdocstheme

Previous OpenStack logo URL from Foundation does not work anymore.
This patch applies a simliar approach
as I368ec2e31055d279b5701cfbbec8a78111e73cb2 but keeps png files
for PDF builds.
Also, modifies minor http -> https

Change-Id: Iec7c7e1d99306c19032377c809bc1772ca036a15
Closes-Bug: #1823514

commit_message:
Allow to override build date with SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH

in order to make builds reproducible.
See https://reproducible-builds.org/ for why this is good
and https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/source-date-epoch/
for the definition of this variable.

Without this patch, building python-debtcollector from a tarball
that does not contain a .git dir varied for every build.

Change-Id: Iaf8bc1c559f5b149a48c9dd05beb0961365fda7e
Signed-off-by: Bernhard M. Wiedemann <bwiedemann@suse.de>

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Idd5ceaf4d50d7181bce2859011b2a0c8206044d5

commit_message:
Make removal of /var/lib/docker best effort - dont fail upgrades

Adds ignore_errors and message for logs incase we couldn't purge
/var/lib/docker. This fails stein jobs see related-bug

Change-Id: I9be9990ff8a34c884c252334fc74a9d39f81654f
(cherry picked from commit 1055a9585d3e531ee1aac585db2b11e3296a0932)

[{'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit af5f7b032376b2f1827daf42e2e55d3a60c6af87'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-04-25 12:58:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

one suggestion inline, and also a question: why didn't we hit that in master before today?"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > one suggestion inline, and also a question: why didn't we hit that
 > in master before today

thanks for reviewing

so the standalone-upgrade hasn't had attention for too long. we are trying to fix it.

the reason we don't see it in master today is because master is broken even earlier than this... right now we have 2 bugs for master.

luckily in stein it doesn't hit those so it gets to this post-upgrade task. I expect master would fail in same way once we get over those (see https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/989 for the bugs on master)

so we can talk about this some more on the friday session at ptg but the focus right now is to fix this job for stein as that one should be the stable and working one right now... 

I don't know exactly when this task started failing... it could be broken for a while now"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-01 17:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-05-03 18:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Make removal of /var/lib/docker best effort - dont fail upgrades

Adds ignore_errors and message for logs incase we couldn't purge
/var/lib/docker. This fails stein jobs see related-bug

Change-Id: I9be9990ff8a34c884c252334fc74a9d39f81654f
Related-Bug: 1826375

It was my impression that swapping a bootable volume from a boot-from-volume instance with a non-bootable volume would break the instance. But upon re-reading the bug, it looks like it doesn't? I had thought this patch was helping prevent a broken instance for the user."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-01 16:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-02 02:50:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This is a super old bug that is arguably not really a bug - I don't see how it's really an issue. You can't boot from a non-bootable volume, which is what the user is trying to do here. If you're swapping the root volume to a non-bootable volume with no image then I'd expect reboot of the server to fail (because where is the operating system for the server?). There could be other weird edge cases like swapping to a non-bootable volume and then rebuilding the server, but we kind of need more details here."}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2019-05-03 17:32:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Abandoned
 > 
 > This is a super old bug that is arguably not really a bug - I don't
 > see how it's really an issue. You can't boot from a non-bootable
 > volume, which is what the user is trying to do here. If you're
 > swapping the root volume to a non-bootable volume with no image
 > then I'd expect reboot of the server to fail (because where is the
 > operating system for the server?). There could be other weird edge
 > cases like swapping to a non-bootable volume and then rebuilding
 > the server, but we kind of need more details here.

Hi Matt,

It’s not a big issue. This patch is trying to provide consistent API experience to the users.
If user tries to boot an instance using non-bootable volume,  the API returns 400 error. In the same way if user tries to swap a volume using non-bootable volume it should also return 400 error."}]

commit_message:
Deny volume swapping with non-bootable volume

Presently, nova allows you to swap a volume used for booting an
instance with a non-bootable volume. Since you are not allowed
to use non-bootable volume for booting an instance so the same
rule should be applied when you are trying to swap a bootable
volume with a non-bootable volume.

This patch will not allow user to swap a bootable volume with a
non-bootable volume. It will return 400 error in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1642492
Change-Id: I32c26ea3db74e8ecd738a182a7cf882deeaa6585

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I097138c3a4262a844819478d0f8a94180d16fa35

commit_message:
Document precedence of config sources

Previously the precedence details for the various sources oslo.config
can consume were scattered around the developer documentation (for
example in [0]). Since this is relevant for users too, we need to
include it in the user-focused documentation.

This collects all of the precedence information I am aware of and puts
it on the documentation page for --config-file, --config-dir, and the
sample source driver options.

It also clarifies the file and dir precedence in the developer docs since
previously that was only available in the API docstring.

Change-Id: I41d8ac0f33ea60aea8ba5b150e53d7eafa323457
0: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/0bc22839b09fcd7ae2de4f7fe5d63ac055fd0a78/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2095
Closes-Bug: 1825859

[{'created': '2019-04-23 17:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move user docs to top of index

The user-oriented docs for oslo.config were buried at the bottom of
the index below a pile of developer docs. This made them difficult to

Change-Id: I602ee587e4acf1c1436b568906e316b78f104814

commit_message:
Move user docs to top of index

The user-oriented docs for oslo.config were buried at the bottom of
the index below a pile of developer docs. This made them difficult to
find. Since we have far more users of oslo.config than we do developers
using it we should prioritize the user docs.

Change-Id: I602ee587e4acf1c1436b568906e316b78f104814

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-02 17:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-01-03 03:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2018-01-03 08:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2018-01-03 08:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this solution is great for development but I'm not sure we actually need it. 2 things:

1) openshift-ansible can be installed using RPMs. If anything we should, eventually, make our package depend on openshift-ansible to make sure it is installed

2. The version we're downloading from git is 3.6, which is the same as we've packaged. While I don't think this is a bad thing, it is weird that we have this logic for a version that we already have in the repos. Perhaps we want to make the version configurable? Like, download the same version as the one we are using for the containers? There's a variable for this already, I believe."}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-03 12:38:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I agree with Flavio - actually with this patch I tried to simplify the development process and allow to use openshift-ansible with custom patches in a home directory. It's obvious that no one will use it in production, but for the developers it could save some time during the deployment.

The next thing I want to add is support for new versions of OpenShift: 3.7, 3.8. In this case we will have to download the code from the source, because rmps are not available.

As a solution I suggest to add a flag option that indicates to install openshift-ansible from rpms if it's possible (default) or download the code from github. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-01-03 17:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Tovin Seven with the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Tovin Seven <tovin07@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-05-03 16:39:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned 10 months no activity.'}]

commit_message:
Check openshift-ansible directory exists

Now the path to openshift-ansible playbook config is hardcoded
to /usr/share/ansible/openshift-ansible/playbooks/byo/config.yaml.
It means that the playbooks must be manually installed before
the deployment.
It is not convenient, so this patch also searches the playbooks in
{{ ansible_user_dir }}/openshift-ansible, and if nothing's found
clones the repo from github.

Change-Id: I22450ee8ee6d80a15c8af55e7efeb79006bb4c07

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Id9a516dc3e748f66278875f22c606a9f7acf41d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 18:56:41.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve a race condition between ceph-key and ceph-injectkey

In a multi-monitor deployment, the contents of a bootstrap key
written by ceph-key-$name can change by the time ceph-injectkey-$name
runs. In the case of the bootstrap-osd key, the race condition
happens this way:
  1) monitor-1 executes ceph-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to create a new keyring on the local file system
  2) monitor-2 executes ceph-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to create a new keyring on the local file system
  3) monitor-2 executes ceph-inject-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to add the client key and caps to the ceph auth list
  4) ceph will distribute the client.bootstrap-osd keyring to
     the other monitors. This will overwrite the keyring written
     in #1 with just the client name and cephx secret.
  5) monitor-1 executes ceph-injectkey-client.bootstrap-osd. The
     diff statement in the unless check will fail because the two
     keyrings will not return 0 because the one in $keyring_path will
     not contain any caps. The exec will fail with an "Error EINVAL:
     auth import: no caps supplied" error because the keyring file
     only has the client name and the cephx secret.

This patch will update the ceph-injectkey-${name} unless statement to do:
 - attempt to pull the current client entry from memory
 - create a TMP_KEYRING with the expected content
 - diff the two keyrings
 - if they are not the same, the TMP_KEYRING will be copied to KERYING_PATH
 - the return value of the diff is returned

If needed, the exec will then import the KEYRING_PATH file. TMP_KEYRING and
KEYRING_PATH will be the same unless #4 from above occurs.

Change-Id: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 17:08:18.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve a race condition between ceph-key and ceph-injectkey

In a multi-monitor deployment, the contents of a bootstrap key
written by ceph-key-$name can change by the time ceph-injectkey-$name
runs. In the case of the bootstrap-osd key, the race condition
happens this way:
  1) monitor-1 executes ceph-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to create a new keyring on the local file system
  2) monitor-2 executes ceph-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to create a new keyring on the local file system
  3) monitor-2 executes ceph-inject-key-client.bootstrap-osd
     to add the client key and caps to the ceph auth list
  4) ceph will distribute the client.bootstrap-osd keyring to
     the other monitors. This will overwrite the keyring written
     in #1 with just the client name and cephx secret.
  5) monitor-1 executes ceph-injectkey-client.bootstrap-osd. The
     diff statement in the unless check will fail because the two
     keyrings will not return 0 because the one in $keyring_path will
     not contain any caps. The exec will fail with an "Error EINVAL:
     auth import: no caps supplied" error because the keyring file
     only has the client name and the cephx secret.

This patch will update the ceph-injectkey-${name} unless statement to do:
 - attempt to pull the current client entry from memory and save as OLD_KEYRING
 - create a TMP_KEYRING with the expected content
 - diff the two keyrings
 - if they are not the same, the TMP_KEYRING will be copied to KERYING_PATH
 - the return value of the diff is returned

If needed, the exec will then import the KEYRING_PATH file. TMP_KEYRING and
KEYRING_PATH will be the same unless #4 from above occurs.

Change-Id: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
'}, {'created': '2018-05-07 18:47:06.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve puppet overwriting a pre-existing bootstrap-osd auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. puppet-ceph has been overwriting this keyring in memory and
on the filesystem. This patch updates ceph::osd to exract the
client keyring from memory and write it to the filesystem. This will
means ceph::key will not need to create the client.bootstrap-osd keyring.

commit_message:
Resolve puppet overwriting a pre-existing bootstrap-osd auth entry

Ceph jewel creates the client.bootstrap-osd auth entry when the cluster
is created. puppet-ceph has been overwriting this keyring in memory and
on the filesystem. This patch updates ceph::osd to exract the
client keyring from memory and write it to the filesystem. This will
means ceph::key will not need to create the client.bootstrap-osd keyring.

Change-Id: I11f134bed59da706a03ce4a70d941145c16f8175
Partial-bug: 1769722

This is a job that runs only on master and it stayed in project-config.
It should not have been imported here as part of python3-first topic,
remove it again.
